description:
Trucking is a multi-hundred billion dollar ecosystem with many brokers, marketplaces, service and data providers. The Integrations team is responsible for connecting the CloudTrucks platform with the rest of the trucking industry. By building partnerships and automated workflows, this team enables core "building blocks" of functionality on the platform like the ability to search across brokers and book jobs with them. These capabilities are critical to scaling CloudTrucks operationally and are used by customers and other product teams every single day.

As an early engineer on the Integrations team, you will make an outsized impact at the company by helping design and build out 3rd party integrations as well as the infrastructure needed to ensure this system scales with the growth of the platform. You will leverage your skills and expertise to make key technical decisions and deliver products that meaningfully impact and empower the truck drivers on our platform, as well as our internal-facing teams.

Examples of projects that you may work on

  • Build new integrations with trucking brokers, allowing our customers to tap into jobs available on the broker's platform. Align with each broker's data flow (push vs pull) and technology choices (REST, GraphQL, SOAP, etc.) as needed.
  • Design a generalized data model and service contract capable of abstracting the complexities and differences across multiple integrations, while providing the pertinent functionality to the rest of the platform.
  • Leverage RPA to turn today's manual operations into automated ones.
  • Redesign our integrations infrastructure to handle 100x the current load, with high performance, visibility, and resilience to failures.

Responsibilities

  • Design, test, ship, and maintain solutions to problems and products.
  • Take complete ownership over projects and features. Work across a range of systems and technologies to deliver end-to-end solutions.
  • Be the primary engineering contact for our 3rd party integration partners.
  • Partner with cross functional teams (Product, Operations, Finance, etc.) to ensure a complete and delightful customer experience.
  • Help set and improve our engineering processes, standards, and tooling.

What we are looking for

  • Strong technical background, including 4+ years of industry experience as a software engineer working on production systems.
  • Self-motivated and comfortable operating in a dynamic environment.
  • Takes a user-focused approach, shipping incrementally with rapid iterations.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills. As a small engineering team, we work closely with each other and other cross functional teams across the company.
  • Experience with web technologies and system design.

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with our technical stack: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Terraform, Google Cloud
  • Experience with distributed systems and building 3rd party integrations.
  • Experience with RPA.

We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

About CloudTrucks
CloudTrucks is a virtual trucking carrier in the multi-billion dollar trucking space. Core to this industry are over 3.5M truck drivers. They move more than 70% of all goods transported around the U.S., yet operate in a highly fragmented industry with huge opportunities for products, services and automation. We strive to deliver solutions that help truck drivers operate with much greater efficiency, increase their revenue, and offload business complexity.

We are looking for uniquely exceptional people to join us on our journey as we massively scale into an industry-defining business. Visit our careers page to learn about our talented team, and read our $20.5M Series A fundraising announcement for more on our mission.

We are looking for a search relevance engineer to work with a team to improve a search based question answering platform. At Moveworks, we build search technology to answer enterprise users’ tech questions instantly, by combining modern information retrieval methodology with the latest advancement in natural language understanding. Our core Search product value is achieved through the capability of accurately retrieving, matching and ranking text snippets extracted from heterogeneous knowledge sources, as direct answers to users’ requests. You will play a critical role in boosting answer quality by meeting the challenges such as lexical gap, semantic text understanding, and data sparsity.

We’re building a team that indexes on moving fast, solving challenging product/engineering problems and providing value to our customers. To be successful, you'll be partnering with product, user experience, customer success and other engineering teams to identify, define and build elegant solutions.

Who we are:

Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees — with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like Snowflake, Slack, DocuSign, LinkedIn, Instacart, Illumina, Epic Games, Hearst Media to move forward on what matters.

Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why both Inc. and the San Francisco Business Times called Moveworks one of the Best Workplaces of 2021.

Come join one of the fastest-growing teams on the planet!

What you’ll do:

  • Craft new ranking features and optimizing existing ones to enhance relevance metrics
  • Develop algorithm framework to support diversified ranking features
  • Design platform and tooling to enable parallel ranking experiments
  • Develop metrics to evaluate ranking performance

What you bring to the table:

  • First-hand experience in traditional information retrieval techniques, or machine learning based ranking models
  • Capable of deriving insights from query logs analysis and identifying areas of improvement for search quality
  • Background in text processing, information retrieval, natural language understanding, or machine learning

Nice to have:

  • Experience in Golang.

ROLE OVERVIEW

Benchling is building a world-class Customer Experience organization to drive the adoption of our solutions across our rapidly growing customer base. The Customer Experience Interns play a key role on the team by contributing to projects on the Customer Success and Implementation teams, as well as directly supporting our customers as they leverage Benchling to transform how their research teams work together.

  • Develop deep knowledge of our products and our customers, including industry segments, the types of research they perform, and how their science is performed in Benchling
  • Be the first line contact for customer questions and issues, work with the appropriate internal teams (e.g. engineering, product management, customer success), to solve problems and manage them through to resolution
  • Provide strong written documentation for a variety of user communications including direct user questions, internal research, FAQ/knowledge content, and others
  • Partner with our Training team to develop and optimize training programs including web-based and video collateral
  • Support the Customer Success and Professional Services teams in a wide variety of user facing activities

WHAT YOU MIGHT WORK ON

  • Projects that expand your learning & understanding of business needs of biotechnology clients
  • Projects that expose you to software implementations
  • Projects that expose you to project management, client engagement, etc.

ABOUT YOU

  • Are working towards a BS or M.Sc. in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Genetics, or similar life science field
  • Have prior experience in a lab or research setting to help you quickly understand complicated scientific concepts and empathize with scientists
  • Are an excellent communicator who can quickly connect with a range of stakeholders from academics, to industry scientists, to project leads
  • Have strong verbal and written communication skills with experience developing various forms of content and presentations
  • Are a self-starter who is autonomous and proactive, with the ability to be successful in a fast paced startup environment with sometimes ambiguous situations
  • Are curious, creative, and tenacious. You will be an advocate for customers, and musty willing to roll up your sleeves and do the hard and sometimes unglamorous work required to make them successful

ROLE OVERVIEW

We're looking for interns to join our Summer 2022 intern class in San Francisco (Benchling HQ). You'll learn to design complex and highly scalable product and systems. Our past interns have built DNA search engines, key pieces of our AWS infrastructure, and analytics pipelines.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Work with and learn from a strong team of scientists and engineers coming from industry leaders. We grow our interns through mentorship and ownership.

  • Own a project from initial research to design, prototype, and maybe large-scale rollout. You might:

    • Research and prototype a way for lab scientists to analyze results using computer vision instead of human review
    • Improve the way we detect and act on outliers in data that Benchling users upload to our systems
    • Build a system to do guided physical experimentation using state-of-the-art optimization algorithms

YOU

  • Are pursuing a PhD degree in a science, statistics, mathematics, or a related technical field.
  • Have prior experience with software engineering (via previous work history, internships, or coursework)
  • Care about the real world impact of your research and code
  • Can work both independently on research and as part of a team to build a more complex product
  • Enjoy ownership and building key pieces of product and/or platform.
  • Are interested in learning about life science, but prior knowledge is not required!

The perks/benefits below are only offered to our full-time Benchling employees

We are looking for a passionate Marketing Intern to help our Campaigns team run cross-functional, global marketing programs. In this role, you will work hand-in-hand with our Small & Medium Business Campaign Manager to strategize, coordinate, and execute campaigns that draw upon the skills of numerous Marketing team members to drive customer demand in key audience segments. You will generate pipeline revenue to support our sales goals while gaining exposure to email marketing, digital marketing, website marketing, content marketing, event marketing, and marketing strategy, among other functional areas. The ideal candidate will be exceptionally detail-oriented and creative, as well as eager to get exposure to many different areas of marketing.

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

  • Work with Small & Medium Business Campaign Manager to craft campaign strategy for new marketing campaigns.
  • Develop campaign messaging to be used across digital assets and events.
  • Coordinate the creation and promotion of new marketing assets, including digital ads, emails, and content.
  • Collaborate with other teams to execute on multi-channel campaign strategy, including Design, Event Marketing, Product Marketing, and Content Marketing.
  • Collaborate with Marketing Operations to analyze the success of campaign programs.
  • Refresh our database of contacts and accounts to ensure data accuracy and completeness.

ABOUT YOU

  • Are working towards a Bachelors or Masters degree in Business, Communication, or similar degree and/or Biology, Chemistry, or similar degree
  • Preferred experience or internships on marketing teams for SaaS companies
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong attention to detail

At Modern Fertility, we’re helping women own their fertility and their future by making reproductive health information more accessible. We provide fertility essentials, including at-home tests and digital tools that help people with ovaries have more power over the decisions impacting their bodies and futures. Now as part of Ro, Modern Fertility is expanding to build the platform that will support women through every step of their health journeys.

At Modern Fertility, we believe that our diverse perspectives are our biggest strengths — and that embracing them will create real change in reproductive health. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to building an inclusive environment where you can be you.

The Role

Modern Fertility is seeking a Strategy and Operations Intern to join our growing team to scale operations and launch products and services that improve access to healthcare for people with ovaries. You will be responsible for helping take ideas from an insight to launch. Your work will span OTC products, medical devices, Rx products, and healthcare services. This person will sit on our Operations team, report to the Director of New Product, and work cross-functionally with everyone on the Modern Fertility team – sharing their expertise to shape company strategy and build a world-class product offering. This is a 3-6 month opportunity dependent on applicant’s availability.

What You'll Do:

  • Support the development of product and company-wide strategy through market and customer research, clinical evaluation, and business case development.
  • Support the development and launch of new products and services.
  • For example, the New Products team over the last two years has been responsible for bringing our pregnancy test, ovulation strips, and prenatal vitamin products from idea to marketDevelop and manage operational capabilities, processes, and systems to enable Modern Fertility to scale quickly.
  • Coordinate cross-functionally with Modern Fertility and Ro team members across the Marketing, Content, Supply Chain, Product & Engineering, and Clinical teams to bring new products and services to market.

What You Bring:

  • You have at least 2-3 years of work experience in a strategic, analytical role in management consulting and/or high growth environments with a track record of building and managing operating processes. Healthcare experience is a bonus.
  • Your communications are well structured and clear. Your comfortable leading conversations with an executive audience.
  • You enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and collaborative environment.
  • You are comfortable owning external relationships. You have demonstrated experience building trusted relationships with external partners, suppliers, and/or advisors.
  • You understand the limitations of your own expertise and have a track record of working with experts to refine your thinking. Experience working with physicians is a bonus.
  • You have an ability to implement clear and effective workflows.
  • You thrive while managing multiple priorities and projects on varying timelines.
  • You’re passionate about building a company with the potential to truly change the status quo in reproductive health.

Modern Fertility is an affiliate of the healthcare technology company Ro.

Ro’s mission is to build a patient-centric healthcare system. We are the only healthcare company in the country to seamlessly integrate nationwide telehealth, in-home care, diagnostics, and pharmacy services to provide high-quality, affordable healthcare — without the need for insurance. Our vertically-integrated primary care platform was built from the ground up to power a personalized, end-to-end healthcare experience for patients.

Since 2017, Ro has facilitated more than eight million digital healthcare visits in nearly every county in the United States, including 98% of primary care deserts. Ro has been named a Best Place to Work in 2021 by Fortune, Inc., and Forbes, as well as Fast Company's 2019 list of the World's Most Innovative Companies.

We welcome qualified candidates of all races, creeds, genders, and sexuality to apply.

See our California Privacy Policy here.

About Ro
Ro is the healthcare technology company building a patient-centric healthcare system. Ro's vertically-integrated primary care platform powers a personalized, end-to-end healthcare experience from diagnosis, to delivery of medication, to ongoing care. With a nationwide provider network, in-home care API, and proprietary pharmacy distribution centers, Ro is the only company to seamlessly connect telehealth and in-home care, diagnostics, and pharmacy services nationwide to provide high-quality, affordable healthcare without the need for insurance. Since 2017, Ro has facilitated more than six million digital healthcare visits in nearly every county in the United States, including 98% of primary care deserts. Ro also provides its patient-centric solutions including Workpath, its in-home care API, and Kit, its at-home diagnostic testing service, to other healthcare companies. Visit Ro.co for more information.

Ro was named #2 in Wellness on Fast Company's 2019 list of the World's Most Innovative Companies, listed by Inc. Magazine as a Best Place to Work in 2020 and 2021, and named one of FORTUNE's 2021 Best Workplaces In Health Care.

As an Engineering Fellow, you will spend a summer on a cross-functional team contributing as product engineer to projects that affect the health and lives of real people across the country. You will work alongside a dedicated engineering mentor as well as other full time engineers of all levels to develop skills in full-stack engineering and project management. We’re looking for entrepreneurial, technically skilled, product-oriented engineers who are passionate about the intersection of healthcare and technology, and who are entering their final year of university after the fellowship summer or a recent graduate. Ro's Engineering Fellowship gives you a seat at the table – instead of focusing on crafting a side project, you'll be contributing directly to mission-critical production features with your team. It is a unique opportunity to dive into Ro’s fast-paced technology team, develop skills as a product-oriented engineer, meet incredible people throughout the organization, and truly contribute to Ro’s mission of becoming patients’ first call.

This is a 12-week long paid remote internship with multiple openings for US Based Rising Seniors.

What You’ll Do:

  • Contribute alongside full-time engineers on applications across Ro’s Django and React stack
  • Regularly meet with a dedicated engineering mentor, who will help steer your growth as a product engineering fellow throughout the summer
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and product, design, and data professionals, throughout the company to understand the needs and priorities of our users and the business
  • Develop skills in full-stack product engineering, project management, cross-team collaboration, and leadership

What You’ll Bring:

  • An entrepreneurial drive, curiosity, proactiveness, and self-motivation
  • Previous experience as an engineer in a product environment. Bonus for experience building and deploying your own projects
  • Interest in the intersection of healthcare and technology
  • Obsession with empathizing with users and building products for broader business problems
  • Strong technical skills: confidence in Python and/or Javascript (ideally Django and familiarity with React specifically), relational databases, REST APIs, and version control
  • Ability to clearly communicate both technical and business concepts
  • Entering your senior year in university after the fellowship summer or a recent graduate

We welcome qualified candidates of all races, creeds, genders, and sexuality to apply.

See our California Privacy Policy here.

Why join us

Brex is reimagining financial systems so every growing company can realize their full potential. As the financial OS, we’re building software and services in one place—disrupting long-entrenched institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our customers.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for Brex and our customers. We believe that engineers should accelerate the business through technology, and collaborate across multiple teams to accomplish that.

Teams are autonomous, value inclusivity, eager to learn, teach and constantly improve how things work. The software we build today is the foundation for dozens of Brex systems in the future, so engineers have a strong sense of ownership and accountability and take pride in their craft.

What you’ll do

We’re looking for folks with an interest in building products, services and infrastructure, comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces. In partnership with your mentor and team, you’ll be building solutions that will drive direct business impact and shape our long-term technical vision with a high-quality bar. You'll have the opportunity to learn and push the frontier of providing the best financial software experience to help companies grow. You’ll be encouraged to be metric and data-driven and to think creatively to help Brex scale and get prepared for the new markets we are about to enter.

  • Design and build solutions across multiple Brex organizations:

    • Foundations: building strong, resilient, and robust APIs, libraries, and tools to power Brex engineers and operations
    • Product: creating customer-facing products and features for our end-users
    • Platform: working on the systems that power Brex’s financial infrastructure, mobile/web experiences and risk/fraud systems

  • Own functionality and scalability features by taking responsibility of your project from inception to deployment, you'll tackle difficult challenges related to scale and functionality

  • Participate in the full software development lifecycle - design, development, testing, operating in production

  • Uphold our high engineering standards and bring consistency to the codebases, infrastructure, and processes you will encounter.

Requirements

  • Graduating from a BA/BS program in 2023
  • Strong knowledge of CS fundamentals
  • Strong communication, interpersonal skills, and eagerness to learn from others
  • Are excited about working in a high-paced environment with other high quality engineers
  • Familiarity with software engineering development cycles
  • Experience working with backend programming languages (i.e. Java, Kotlin, Python)
  • If Frontend, experience working with Typescript, React, and React Native
  • Experience working with SQL or NoSQL databases
  • Ability to hold yourself and the team to high standards

Bonus points

  • Experience collaborating with experts in product, design, and operations
  • Familiarity with functional programming languages
  • Strong writing skills
  • Proactive approach
  • Experience with corporate financial systems or concepts
  • Experience with cloud computing systems & services

About Abnormal Security:

Founded in 2018, Abnormal Security is defining the next generation of email security defense. Our platform uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to baseline communication content, user identity, and behavioral signals in real-time and at-scale in order to detect the abnormalities of email attacks.

Customers love us because we consistently detect and stop what everyone else in the market can’t -- advanced attacks that have never been seen before -- and we do so with beautiful user interfaces and best-in-industry customer support. Our customers and the cybersecurity industry is noticing our success - we’re on the Forbes AI 50, selected as a Gartner 2020 Cool Vendor, and our customer base includes multiple Fortune 500 companies.

Our veteran team has built some of the most enduring machine learning platforms at leading companies including Google, Twitter, Pinterest, Amazon, Microsoft, and Expanse. We are located in San Francisco and New York City.

Our technology relies on reliable, scalable infrastructure that can keep up with the growing demands and needs of our customers. We are growing our engineering team responsible for designing, scaling, and securing our infrastructure. Your work will be open ended, but goal directed.

Position Summary:

You will be an intern on one of Abnormal Security's engineering teams. You'll be expected to work closely with your teammates to deliver system improvements & new product features, and participate in all team processes.

Requirements:

  • In process of attaining Bachelor’s in Computer Science, or equivalent subject expertise in systems and infrastructure
  • Previous startup work experience, or working in the early stages of a product’s lifecycle
  • Strong sense of proactive ownership - taking pride and responsibility for the quality of all systems and products we deliver to our customers
  • Hard-working attitude and eager to work closely with other engineering team members.
  • Familiar with Python

Nice To Haves:

  • Previous startup experience

Why Abnormal Security:

  • Competitive pay and equity
  • One of the most proven engineering teams in Silicon Valley
  • Best-in-class customer traction and growth
  • Team-wide commitment to excellence, velocity, and customer-focus
  • Strong growth opportunities and high ownership expectations
  • Full medical, dental, and vision health insurance benefits
  • Daily catered lunches and snacks
  • Generous PTO

About Sentry

Bad software is everywhere, and we’re tired of it. Sentry is on a mission to help developers write better software faster, so we can get back to enjoying technology.

With more than $127 million in funding and 70,000 organizations that believe we’re on to something, we're building performance and error monitoring tools that help companies like Disney, Microsoft, and Atlassian spend less time fixing bugs and more time building products. If you like to selfishly build things that make your digital life better, come help us build the next generation of software monitoring tools.

In this section, we recommend opening with a quick paragraph about the team (if it exists). If possible, highlight the scope of work the team takes on, what challenges they face, etc.

For the second paragraph, dive into the role itself. At a high-level, talk about what the person will be doing. You'll get an opportunity to go into more detail in a moment.

About the Role

Software Engineering Interns at Sentry write real code on real projects that ship to production; no fetching coffee required.

In this role you will:

  • Be matched with one of our Product or Infrastructure Engineering teams, based on your interests and experience
  • Design, develop, and ship a programming solution that drives real values to customers (and if time permits, write about it on our blog)
  • Act on feedback, coaching, and mentorship from your manager and teammates

You'll love this job if:

  • You want to experience being a full-time engineer on a team and not be "just an intern"
  • You value mentorship and being able to work closely with and learn from world-class engineers
  • You want to join a modern software development team that iterates and ships code rapidly
  • You're excited at the opportunity to contribute to an open-source project every day

See work that other interns have completed:

  • Implementing Sentry for Apache Beam
  • Usage Metrics for the Sentry Integration Platform
  • Error Monitoring for PySpark

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or post-graduate degree program in Computer Science (or similar)
  • At least 1 previous internship or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience with Python, Javascript, or a similar dynamic programming language through internships, personal projects (GitHub), or coding competitions
  • You know the fundamentals of algorithms and data structures
  • Willing to relocate to SF for the duration of your internship (we'll help get you here and provide a housing stipend)

Learn More About Sentry

  • Earlier this year, we raised our Series D, at a $1B valuation! Learn more on Venture Beat, Business Insider, and TechCrunch.
  • We're constantly writing about...us. Check out our blog here.
  • We're also tweeting away. Keep up with us on Twitter

Benefits

  • Competitive paid internship
  • 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for interns
  • Monthly commuter subsidy
  • Flexible working schedule and vacation policy, work from home policy, and real work/life balance
  • Catered lunches
  • Company events (Hack Weeks, All Hands, quarterly social events) and friends and family events
  • Relocation assistance - you are living in, or willing to relocate to the San Francisco Bay Area

COVID Vaccine Required - Reasonable Accommodations for Medical or Religious Reasons Considered

Sentry values diversity and inclusivity in our company and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Company

Gantri is a new kind of design manufacturer. We help designers create high-quality, affordable and sustainable modern designs and sell directly to consumers. Our secret? Manufacturing products on-demand using cutting-edge 3D printing and innovative plant-based materials.

Since launching lighting in 2017, we've collaborated with some of world's best designers, studios and brands, including Ammunition, Dims and Muka Design Lab. We’re the winner of Time’s Best Inventions 2020, Fast Company’s Most Innovative in Design 2020, Gear Patrol’s Top 100 Products of 2020, Architectural Digest’s Cleverest Awards 2020 and many other awards.

Role

Gantri is looking for a passionate React engineer to build out our award-winning online marketplace, designer Create Hub and manufacturing dashboard. You'll design, build, and maintain performant, responsive, and delightful experiences for our users. You'll also facilitate quality by writing unit tests and participating in code reviews

We develop rapidly with ongoing releases and have exciting challenges around augmented reality, AI-powered design validation and manufacturing automation. This role would closely collaborate with product, design and manufacturing to deliver amazing experiences for consumers and designers on the web.

We view each engineer as a true product engineer with a high degree of ownership and autonomy. We are a lean, fast-moving team that prefers to avoid meetings and focus 100% on driving impact.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Computer Science or related fields
  • At least 5 years of experiences in building robust frontend applications
  • Proven ability to deliver an amazing user experience.
  • Experience in building scalable solutions with a high level of code quality through automated tests and good architecture.
  • Deep expertise in Javascript, HTML and CSS.
  • Strong team player with excellent communication skills and a high degree of ownership and drive.
  • A passion for design and manufacturing.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and equity
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance
  • Paid vacation days and paid holidays
  • Work from X benefits
  • Access to 3D printers for your personal projects
  • Monthly team lunches
  • And much more

position: Senior Software Engineer - CT Cash (Financial Products)
description:
Our customers have unique financial needs and are severely underbanked. We believe that financial products are critical to the success of truck drivers, and that's why we partnered with Visa to build CT Cash, a first of its kind mobile wallet and instant payment solution.

As an early engineer on the financial products team, you will make an outsized impact at the company by helping build out a financial ecosystem, capable of significantly improving the cash flow and access to banking solutions for our customers. You will leverage your skills and expertise to make key technical decisions and deliver products that meaningfully impact and empower the truck drivers on our platform, as well as our internal-facing teams.

Examples of projects that you may work on

  • Work with our partners to design and integrate a fuel rewards program so that customers using their CT Cash card at gas stations can receive cash back rewards.
  • Integrate our financial products with our core operating workflows across the platform to provide a fully embedded experience to our customers.
  • Build a financial ledger to track and manage all cash movement, inflows, and outflows over the CloudTrucks platform.
  • Launch banking and lending products to help our customers best manage their business.

Responsibilities

  • Work on our financial infrastructure, responsible for all money movement on the platform.
  • Design, test, ship, and maintain solutions to original fintech problems and products.
  • Take complete ownership over projects and features. Work across a range of systems and technologies to deliver end-to-end solutions.
  • Partner with cross functional teams (Product, Operations, Finance, etc.) to ensure a complete and delightful customer experience.
  • Help set and improve our engineering processes, standards, and tooling.

What we are looking for

  • Strong technical background, including 4+ years of industry experience as a software engineer working on production systems.
  • Self-motivated and comfortable operating in a dynamic environment.
  • Takes a user-focused approach, shipping incrementally with rapid iterations.

About CloudTrucks
CloudTrucks is a virtual trucking carrier in the multi-billion dollar trucking space. Core to this industry are over 3.5M truck drivers. They move more than 70% of all goods transported around the U.S., yet operate in a highly fragmented industry with huge opportunities for products, services and automation. We strive to deliver solutions that help truck drivers operate with much greater efficiency, increase their revenue, and offload business complexity.

We are looking for uniquely exceptional people to join us on our journey as we massively scale into an industry-defining business. Visit our careers page to learn about our talented team, and read our $20.5M Series A fundraising announcement for more on our mission.

The Core Products team is responsible for our customer facing product. We work closely with Product and other cross functional teams to identify the tools and functionality that can help our customers better run and manage their trucking business. From onboarding, to background checks, to job search and booking, the Core Products team takes end to end ownership over building or integrating the application logic, crafting the APIs, and designing a delightful frontend experience.

As an early engineer on the Core Products team, you will make an outsized impact at the company by collaborating with cross functional teams to model and build the products that our customers interact with everyday. CloudTrucks is building a platform that simplifies and reimagines what is needed to operate a trucking business. We are still early on that journey and you will be able to make key technical decisions and deliver new products that meaningfully impact and empower the truck drivers on our platform.

Examples of projects that you may work on

  • Build a referral program so drivers are rewarded when they refer others to the platform.
  • Add an integration with a background check provider, to the onboarding flow, to ensure driver quality and safety.
  • Enable users to search for and book loads across the brokers and marketplaces that CloudTrucks integrates with.
  • Build a web application to allow customers with admin privileges the ability to manage all the drivers and equipment in their fleet.

Responsibilities

  • Design, test, ship, and maintain solutions to original problems and products.
  • Take complete ownership over projects and features. Work across a range of systems and technologies to deliver end-to-end solutions.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to ensure a complete and delightful customer experience.
  • Help set and improve our engineering processes, standards, and tooling.

What we are looking for

  • Strong technical background, including 4+ years of industry experience as a software engineer working on production systems.
  • Self-motivated and comfortable operating in a dynamic environment.
  • Takes a user-focused approach, shipping incrementally with rapid iterations.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills. As a small engineering team, we work closely with each other and other cross functional teams across the company.
  • Experience with web technologies and system design.

Nice to haves

  • Experience with our technical stack: Python, Django, Javascript, Typescript, React, Google Cloud
  • Full-stack experience.

position: Senior Software Engineer - Console (Business Workflows & Automation)
description:
CloudTrucks provides a "business in a box" solution for truck drivers, taking on the back office business operations and tasks involved in running a trucking business. The Console team is responsible for our internal facing web application. The tooling and products surfaced there, allow our Operations, Customer Success, Finance, Engineering and Safety teams to effectively manage a customer's business as well as the overall health of the platform. The Console team adopts a tech forward approach to solving business problems, so, in addition to designing the data models and business workflows, we are constantly looking for ways to introduce automation.

As an early engineer on the Console team, you will make an outsized impact at the company by collaborating with cross functional teams to model and automate complex business processes. Your work will be critical to CloudTruck's ability to scale and grow as a business. You will leverage your skills and expertise to make key technical decisions and deliver products that meaningfully impact and empower the truck drivers on our platform, as well as our internal-facing teams.

Examples of projects that you may work on

  • Automate document processing. We receive lots of PDFs with similar content in varying formats and layouts from different brokers we work with. Build a document processing engine that is able to take an unstructured PDF and extract structured data. Leverage this capability to fully automate business workflows and remove the need for manual processing.
  • Add geofencing capabilities to gain operational visibility on when truck drivers are picking up or dropping off their loads.
  • Work with cross functional teams to design and automate the lifecycle of a job on the CloudTrucks platform. Modeling everything from customers booking a job, to verifying delivery and issuing payment, to sending out invoices to brokers on job completion.

Responsibilities

  • Design, test, ship, and maintain solutions to problems and products.
  • Take complete ownership over projects and features. Work across a range of systems and technologies to deliver end-to-end solutions.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to ensure a complete and delightful customer experience.
  • Help set and improve our engineering processes, standards, and tooling.

What we are looking for

  • Strong technical background, including 4+ years of industry experience as a software engineer working on production systems.
  • Self-motivated and comfortable operating in a dynamic environment.
  • Takes a user-focused approach, shipping incrementally with rapid iterations.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills. As a small engineering team, we work closely with each other and other cross functional teams across the company.
  • Experience with web technologies and system design.

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with our technical stack: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, React, Typescript, Javascript, Google Cloud
  • Full-stack experience.

About CloudTrucks
CloudTrucks is a virtual trucking carrier in the multi-billion dollar trucking space. Core to this industry are over 3.5M truck drivers. They move more than 70% of all goods transported around the U.S., yet operate in a highly fragmented industry with huge opportunities for products, services and automation. Our mission is to bring blockchain to a billion people. The Alchemy Platform is a world class developer platform designed to make building on the blockchain easy. We've built leading infrastructure in the space, powering over $30 billion in transactions for tens of millions of users in 99% of countries worldwide.

The Alchemy team draws from decades of deep expertise in massively scalable infrastructure, AI, and blockchain from leadership roles at leading companies and universities like Google, Microsoft, Facebook, Stanford, and MIT.

Alchemy recently raised a Series B led by Coatue and Addition, having previously raised from Stanford University, Coinbase, the Chairman of Google, Charles Schwab, and the founders and executives of leading organizations.

Alchemy powers the top blockchain companies globally and has been featured in TechCrunch, Forbes, Bloomberg, and elsewhere.

The Role

As a summer intern, you’ll work directly with our world class engineering team to push forward your own project from end to end. There is a lot to do and a lot to learn, so be prepared to dive in headfirst for 12-14 weeks as you immerse yourself in the world of blockchain. We’re growing fast and moving even faster so we can’t say exactly what you’ll be working on next summer, but potential projects range from developing new APIs and features to creating internal tooling. So join us on our mission to bring blockchain to a billion people.

Responsibilities

  • Apply knowledge from course work and learnings from previous experiences to real world problems
  • Collaborate with the engineering team and work closely with your mentor to deliver on a well-scoped project
  • Move quickly and learn about the blockchain space

What We're Looking For

  • Pursuing a Bachelors (Juniors/Seniors only), Masters, or PhD with a focus on subjects related to software development, computer science and/or mathematics
  • Experience coding in at least two general purpose programming language, preferably Java, Typescript or Python
  • Interest in the blockchain space, demonstrated with course work, extracurriculars, open source contributions and/or work experience
  • At least one previous Software Engineering internship with proven ability to execute and exposure to real-world systems
  • Strong verbal and written English communication skills
  • Exposure to web application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, and networking is a plus
  • Ability to work in San Francisco or New York

position: Social Media Fall Internship (WeChat and Red Platform focused)
description:
Who We Are

Tomocredit is an exciting fintech startup based in the heart of San Francisco and was built by young immigrant founders who felt the pain of getting a credit card as a foreign national. We are dedicated to building the smartest card that does not require a credit score for approval.
Millions of Americans can’t access affordable credit, simply because they have no credit history. Without good credit, everything becomes difficult and more expensive— auto loans, insurance rates, mortgages— even job applications are affected by your credit score.

We are looking for an individual who is passionate about content creating, specifically TikTok and Instagram reels, to help us elevate our social media presence and create content that we will feature on our page! If you are passionate about content creating, already have experience in taking TikToks / Instagram reels and want to get more into the fintech space, this is the internship for you!

*Requirements *

● Create original photography content for Tomocredit social media platforms- Photograph friends, family, or strangers on the street (with their permission) to create photo content that matches our brand

● Experienced with China’s popular social media platforms (WeChat and Red)

● Clear and effective communicator who will coordinate with our marketing team about content needs & attend weekly marketing meetings

● Able to read and write Chinese

*Qualifications *

To be successful in this position, you need to have experience in creating content and utilizing the WeChat and Red platform very well in order to capture the audience. Must have an outgoing personality that allows you to approach people comfortably. Must be able to consistently produce quality videos either with a high quality phone camera or DSLR.

To be considered for this role please fill out the application and post on your WeChat or Red account of an original video created by you promoting Tomocredit. Email the video link to kyle.lu@tomocredit.com to ensure we don’t miss your submission!

Perks
● Flexible schedule, work from wherever, whenever
● Friendly work environment. You will get to work with a team of creative marketing intens, designer and growth marketer.
● See your videos on our social media pages
● Chance to build your portfolio with an up-and-coming fintech company (Fintech is on the rise, $300 billion industry in the U.S alone)
Website: tomocredit.com
Red: tomocredit
Instagram: tomocredit
Medium:https://medium.com/@TomoCredit/tomo-my-first-credit-card-as-an-international-student-no-credit-score-required-5c0b1cd092db

Meet The Team
The founding team is made up of immigrant founders who have all experienced the struggles to get a credit card. Previously, we were at MIT, UC Berkeley, Charles Schwab. We are backed by top tier investors from Barclays, Venmo, Coinbase, Paypal, etc. You can read more about us in TechCrunch.

position: Sales Development and Event Registration Intern

location.city: London • Bellevue • Tokyo • Buenos Aires • Singapore • Sydney • Remote

description:
We are looking for motivated individuals to join our fast-growing company as a Sales Development and Event Registration Intern. During this time, the intern will become an integral part of the Corporate Events and Sales Teams by driving event registrations for Okta’s annual customer conference, Oktane.

Significant time will be spent working within the Salesforce.com application, with Okta account executives, and customer success managers to recruit event attendees. This internship will have a measurable impact on Okta’s strategy and customer experience at Oktane.

We’re looking for someone who has proven ability to manage multiple projects at once, will pay attention to the small details (while also thinking creatively), and can help drive results with cross-functional team members.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Increase Oktane registrations by aligning to a sales segment and helping to build and prioritize strategic target account lists
  • Evangelize Okta’s product portfolio and the value of attending Oktane
  • Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest through cold calls, and email campaigns
  • Provide event registration support through the Drift (chatbot)
  • Other projects as needed
  • Work within Salesforce to help customers redeem passes to the conference

Minimum Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university
  • Highly motivated, self-starter attitude
  • 1-year Marketing or Sales experience preferred (previous internships or part-time work)
  • Comfortable talking with prospects and internal/external customers through phone and email, to help build great customer relationships.
  • Extremely organized and detail-oriented
  • Ability to collaborate with team members while identifying opportunities to contribute value individually
  • Experience with Excel, Google Sheets, Salesforce, Outreach, Drift, Tableau, and Atlassian preferred

This internship opportunity can be part-time or full-time and is anticipated to last through April 2022.

Okta is rethinking the traditional work environment, providing our employees with the flexibility to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, no matter where they are located. We enable a flexible approach to work, meaning for roles where it makes sense, you can work from the office, or from home, regardless of where you live. Okta invests in the best technologies and provides flexible benefits and collaborative work environments/experiences, empowering employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Find your place at Okta https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:

Tuesday, September 28, 2021

1:00pm–1:45pm PDT

https://events.okta.com/adayinthelifeofanoktaintern

Software Engineering Intern Job Description

Role Location: San Francisco, CA, San Jose, CA, Bellevue, WA, Toronto, ON Canada (virtual and in-person options available)

Position Description: We are looking for University students pursuing a Computer Science or related degree who are interested in a 2022 Summer Internship and that are passionate about building large-scale, mission-critical software in a fast-paced agile environment. The ideal candidate will share our passion and pride in the simple elegance and usability of our solution. Our interns will join an engineering team that strongly believes in automated testing, UX design and an iterative process to build high-quality next generation enterprise software.

We offer: High priority projects, great mentors, hackathons and Lunch-n-Learns with Okta leaders. Interns will have a choice of virtual or in-person internships.

We have opportunities across a wide range of areas within our organization.

Our team is innovative and flexible; with a weekly release cycle and individual ownership we expect great things from all of our engineers and reward them with stimulating new projects, emerging technologies and the chance to have significant impact in a company that is changing the cloud computing landscape forever. We have offices in San Francisco, CA, San Jose, CA and Bellevue, WA in the United States and Toronto, ON in Canada.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Analyze/Refine requirements with Product Owner and Tech Lead
  • Work with engineering management to scope and plan engineering efforts
  • Design and implement high-performance, scalable, reusable and maintainable software that will see real-world action
  • Participate in test-driven development, design and code reviews
  • Interface with TechOps, Documentation, and Design teams

Minimum Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Interest in software development experience, and testing that supports building highly reliable, mission-critical software.
  • Ability to program in at least one OO programming language (e.g. Java, JavaScript, C#, C++)
  • Knowledge of web application frameworks, RDBMS & application servers (experience in one or more preferred)
  • Reasonable understanding of network security, encryption, authentication and authorization
  • Academic experience in data structures and algorithms
  • Ability to apply knowledge gained in computer science courses to real world problems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Selenium, JQuery
  • .Net, Windows development and JavaScript a plus
  • Past summer internship experience, ideally in enterprise software companies

Education and Training: (In progress) BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or related field

Who we are...
AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.

What we are looking for…
The AvantStay Internship Program offers a unique look into the quickly growing short-term rental market. We will open the doors to this new real estate asset class coupled with high-tech solutions that will provide an unparalleled guest experience. This is an opportunity to build a career in a massive industry growing at an exponential rate. Our interns are tasked with real, meaningful projects and responsibilities aimed at helping build both the Company and the skillset of the intern. AvantStay provides growth opportunities and mentorship in a fast-paced environment and seeks those who are passionate about hospitality, real estate, and technology.

This internship is a flexible, part-time, remote internship that requires 15-20 hours per week for 10-12 weeks depending on availability.

What you'll do...

  • Work directly with our Head of Growth to identify new opportunities to generate buzz and excitement around new properties, destinations, and product initiatives.
  • Play a role in developing marketing strategies on paid digital platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, TikTok).
  • Report on important metrics for each digital campaign -- this includes, but is not exclusive to, impressions, clicks, conversions, CPA, and LTV.
  • Track key growth KPIs, such as Active Users, Sessions, Bounce Rate, and Guest NPS every week.

What you'll bring...

  • You are pursuing an undergraduate degree with an accredited University, ideally studying Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, Journalism/Advertising, or a related field.
  • Creative and collaborative - you love working with a team and solving challenging problems.
  • You are an effective communicator, both written and verbal.
  • You’re organized, dependable, self-motivated & have the ability to multi-task.
  • Experience in Microsoft Office with a solid foundation in Excel reporting and analysis.
  • Eagerness to learn about growth and digital marketing strategy

Perks + Benefits

  • Competitive Hourly Rate (DOE)
  • Team bonding and Company events
  • Dog-friendly environment

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside an experienced and dynamic team, transforming the way people travel and vacation. LVL is a premium financial services company that offers cryptocurrency trading and a checking account in one easy-to-use mobile app. LVL is the only platform in North America to offer free Bitcoin trading - no trading fees and no hidden spreads. LVL also offers neobank features such as direct deposit, wires, mobile check deposits, and a Mastercard debit card.

LVL has received $4.5M in funding from top investors including TenOneTen, Morgan Creek Digital, Capital Factory, and others.

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for LVL and our customers. We believe that engineers should accelerate the business through technology, and collaborate across multiple teams to accomplish that. They will work cross-functionally across the company, interfacing directly with vendors, triaging with support, and managing compliance risk. The engineering team is autonomous, eager to learn, teach and constantly improve how things work.

The Software Engineer will report to the CEO and will:

  • Publish OTA updates to LVL’s React Native app weekly, sometimes daily
  • Triage technical issues with support, develop solutions, plan sprints, and follow through to completion
  • Learn new technologies and seamlessly integrate them into LVL’s tech stack
  • Improve scalability and reliability by implementing best practices around containerization, continuous integration, load balancing
  • Build and maintain asynchronous task queues and microservices
  • Manage database migrations in production environments
  • Design APIs and integrate with external APIs
  • Build internal tools for day-to-day operations, marketing data and analytics, and site reliability. Optimized for automation.

The Basics:

Tanium is looking for a curious, driven, and hardworking individual to join its Global Sales Strategy & Operations organization as a 2022 Summer Intern. This role will interact with various teams and levels of management, and the right candidate must have the ability to communicate with multiple levels across Sales, Finance, and other Operations teams.

This person must be an analytical and critical thinker, a problem solver, a curious deep diver, and a clear communicator. She/he must be able to roll-up their sleeves, and work directly with the models and data, while also keeping the bigger picture in mind when sharing any findings or narratives with the rest of the business. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, independent, confident speaking to a group, and naturally inquisitive. This person may also maintain strategic alignment with sales operations and sales leadership, provide value-add business insights and organizational support, and build programs and efficient processes that drive growth.

The position can be located anywhere in the continental United States.

What you’ll do:

About Tanium:

Tanium offers an endpoint management and security platform built for the world’s most demanding IT environments. Many of the world’s largest and most sophisticated organizations — including nearly half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and multiple branches of the U.S. Armed Forces — rely on Tanium to make confident decisions, operate efficiently, and remain resilient against disruption. Tanium has been named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list of “Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing” for five consecutive years and ranks 4th on FORTUNE’s list of the “Best Workplaces in Technology 2020.”

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it’s imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things.

Taking care of our team members

Each of our team members has 5 days set aside as volunteer time off (VTO) to contribute to the communities they live in and give back to the causes they care about most.

At Tanium, Product Management Interns have the opportunity to gain valuable, real-world experience in building business to business security focused applications. Working with a mentor in our product management team you’ll be placed on a product team featuring projects vetted by our mentors. Over the course of the internship, supported by your mentor, and working with cross functional teams to build products and features used by our customers.

What You’ll Do

Product Management Interns will successfully lead a visible, valuable change to the product set. Past examples include:

  • Improve an existing capability by understanding use cases, proposing improvements, driving execution, and reviewing results.
  • Integrate with an external system, such as a report export or a command import, addressing the use case, technical needs, enablement, and marketing.
  • Have a great time! Tanium’s a fun place to work, we think you’ll like it here.

Qualifications

  • Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or Related degree
  • Technology background, preferably with related software products
  • Demonstrated success in working with engineering teams to plan, develop, and launch successful software features

About Tanium:

At Tanium, we make it our mission to empower the world’s largest organizations to manage and protect their mission-critical networks. Nothing makes us happier than seeing customers’ faces light up as they realize the lightning-fast capabilities at their fingertips to see everything and do anything across their computer networks – with unparalleled scale.

We pride ourselves on being unstoppable in the pursuit of our mission. We are diverse problem solvers driven to do the right thing and win as a team.

If you are looking to join a fast-growing, mission-driven company, and want to make a lasting impact on the organization and the industry, we'd love to talk to you. Learn more at www.tanium.com.

The Basics:

At Tanium, Engineering Interns have the opportunity to gain valuable, real-world experience in building business to business security focused applications. Working with a mentor in our engineering team you’ll select a project from a library of prototype, internal tool, and product feature projects vetted by our mentors. Over the course of the internship, supported by your mentor, and working with our engineers you’ll implement the project and present what you’ve built to Tanium’s engineering team.

Examples of prior projects include:

  • Question prediction for Tanium’s natural language parser
  • A Node.js module for presenting application health

Preferred Qualifications:

What you’ll do:

  • Experience first-hand engineering in a software security company
  • Develop web based applications built in common frontend and backend frameworks
  • Work as a member of Tanium’s engineering team
  • Show off what you’ve built
  • Have a great time. Tanium’s a fun place to work, we think you’ll like it here

About Tanium:

At Tanium, we offer a proven platform for endpoint visibility and control that transforms how the world's largest and most sophisticated organizations manage and secure their computing devices with unparalleled speed and agility. There’s a reason why more than half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and four branches of the US Armed Forces rely on Tanium.

Our unstoppable spirit, drive to do the right thing and win as a team attitude has earned us the rank of 7th on the Forbes list of “Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing” for 2019 and 10th on FORTUNE’s list of the “100 Best Medium Workplaces.”

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it’s imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. About JW Player

JW Player pioneered video on the web over a decade ago and continues to innovate as the world’s largest network-independent platform for video delivery and intelligence. Media companies including Fox, VICE, Business Insider, and Univision, in addition to hundreds of thousands of creators of all types and sizes, rely on JW Player to deliver and monetize their content across all devices. JW Player’s massive global footprint of over 2 billion unique devices creates a powerful data graph of unique consumer insights and generates billions of incremental video views. The company is headquartered in New York, with offices in London and Eindhoven, and was named to Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™ in 2017. For more information, visit http://www.jwplayer.com.

Company Description

Butterfly Network’s mission is to democratize healthcare by enabling universal access to superior medical imaging. We reinvented ultrasound technology by creating the world's first handheld, single-probe whole-body ultrasound system: the Butterfly iQ. This innovative technology reduces the cost of the traditional ultrasound system by miniaturizing it onto a single semiconductor silicon chip.

Butterfly harnesses the advantages of AI and cloud computing to deliver advanced imaging that is easy-to-use and built for the digital era.The Butterfly iQ and next- generation Butterfly iQ+ have received CE Mark and FDA clearance, and are being sold in hospitals and clinics around the globe.

Joining Butterfly Network is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.

position: Part-Time Social Media and Content Internship
description:
The Wellness Feed is looking for a passionate, self-driven, Part-Time Social Media Intern who is looking for exposure to the many things it takes to make a digital media brand successful. This person will leave this role as a start-up social media & content ninja, with exposure across various platforms, industry-insider newsletters and developing campaigns with brands and influencers. You’ll gain hands-on experience working on meaningful projects with guidance from a mentor and other members of our team.

This role is also for a purpose-driven company that looks at how readers can live a sustainable lifestyle. So, an interest in and passion for tackling issues related to climate change, inclusivitiy, and the environment is a must!

Opportunity to work remote. Or, in the Philadelphia office.

Responsibilities include:

Support leadership in any/all facets of strategic company initiatives
Manage company Social Media presence across all platforms- Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest and possibl Tiktok
Contribute to content strategy to engage and build social media presence
Support promotion efforts with brands through ideation and implementation of campaigns, stories and posts
Assist in various stages of the sales funnel, including increasing brand awareness, generating leads, closing opportunities, and retaining customers
Support custom communication strategies emails to support clients through the conversion funnel

KPIs
Brand Channel KPI’s (impressions, engagement, followers)
Lead generation via owned media channels
Content production

Qualifications:

Experience in creating social media content- specially Reels and Instagram stories
A deep understanding of Instagram & Facebook- algorithm updates and preferences, in app tools such as Reels and engaging Instagram story tools
A deep understanding of Pinterest- algorithm updates and preferences how it works
Must be independent. Can self-manage and prioritize multiple tasks at a time
Excellent interpersonal and written / verbal communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
Attention to detail and ability to listen toa manager is key
Past Start-Up or Sales/Marketing experience in any capacity is a plus

Why The Wellness Feed?

The Wellness Feed is 'news you can use'. Climate change is scary. But, we want our readers to feel that there is something they can do about it. And, we want to lift the curtain to ask brands the hard questions and get real insight from experts about how we can all live more sustianably, day by day.

We're a boutique online platfrom that prides itself on a mission to lead readers towards a more sustainable lifestyle. As a startup, we're a growing team that fosters relationships with great brands, an inclusive company culture and employee growth. This role is an opportunity to join a growing comapny and grow into a larger position while contributing to the company's success. Plus, you'll be a part of a purpose-driven company.

We're looking for candidates that are driven self-starters with a great sense of humor. Seriously! We're always learning and trying to think about what is coming next in the media landscape.

Please send your resume, a quick cover letter to introduce yourself and any applicable work samples to info@thewellnessfeed.com

description:
Overview:

Potato TV is looking for a software engineer intern to help develop the foundation of our social streaming product. The ideal applicant will have a passion for social media, streaming, and connecting people through the TV & movies they love. We are looking for people who want to work on a fun product & who want to make an immediate impact. Successful interns will have an ability to understand our technical approaches, provide innovative solutions, and build efficiently for the future.

Opportunities:

  • Agile development of high-quality native iOS apps with beautiful custom UI.
  • Develop backend functionality & frontend experience for an interactive messaging, video, and audio mobile application
  • Contribute to product design processes (ideation, user journeys, roadmapping, etc…) & learn how they are implemented into product development.
  • Troubleshooting and debugging issues that arise using industry standards
  • Develop, maintain, & update technical documentation for team members
  • Build a social platform experience across mobile & web app surfaces
  • Learn and apply software design and development concepts to our mobile application

About you:

  • Experience with Swift, various iOS frameworks, and modern iOS APIs.
  • Experience working in cloud computing environments like GCP & firebase & building backend models with noSQL DBs & node JS.
  • Familiarity with using APIs for chat, video, & websockets.
  • Preferred Education: Currently enrolled in or have previously completed a Masters in computer science. Minimum is graduated with BS in CS.
  • Great communication: ability to breakdown technical concepts effectively to non-technical founders
  • Mindset: Human-centered design - Put the user at the center of development
  • Collaborative: With other engineers on projects to seamlessly build a cohesive product using industry standard tools and processes
  • Ability to break down requirements and implement whole features

Commitment:

  • Time: ~20 hours/week
  • Duration: 10-12 weeks
  • Role: Unpaid internship
  • Location: Remote

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Figure is a modern compensation platform that helps companies centralize their data, set their pay structure, benchmark themselves against similar companies in real-time, and communicate total rewards to their candidates and employees. Figure streamlines painful and complicated manual compensation processes into simple, secure, and collaborative workflows - say goodbye to spreadsheets. Our mission is to bring equity and transparency to compensation -- for companies, employees, and candidates.

Why join us?
Figure is looking for software engineers to join our founding team. More than anything, we seek individuals with strong coding fundamentals. We work in a highly collaborative environment. Our team is still small, and people wear many hats. You will have the opportunity to jump between engineering, product, customer support, and design - participating in every part of the business from idea to production.

Our stack

  • PostgreSQL database
  • Ruby on Rails backend
  • Graphql API
  • React / Apollo frontend

Key responsibilities

  • Design, build and deploy features end to end. You are responsible for breaking down high level features into tasks that can ship to prod.
  • Code quickly and test thoroughly - Maintain the balance between velocity and code health.
  • Work on a team - Collaborate with other engineers to design and architect features. Know when to ask for help when you are stuck.
  • Write well-documented, clean, testable code

Requirements

  • You have 3+ years of engineering experience, and have built and scaled products.
  • You are a faster learner - You can readily learn most technologies as you go.
  • You understand the business implications beyond engineering - You are not just coding cool stuff. You understand the balance between engineering, speed, and the bottom line.
  • Strong work ethic and willingness to do what it takes to deliver results
  • Entrepreneurial, with a high tolerance for ambiguity

Bonus Points

  • Comfortable integrating with 3rd party APIs that are sometimes not well documented
  • Experience with data privacy/security
  • You’ve built side projects from idea to MVP
  • Experience working with or building HR/Compensation tools

Benefits

  • Generous equity package
  • 100% health + dental + vision
  • 401k
  • Unlimited vacations
  • $5,000 for your own setup (laptop, desk, chair)

Who we are
Figure is a seed-stage company with a remote-first culture and an office in San Francisco. We have raised a seed round of $7.5M led by CRV and other investors including Bling Capital, Garage Capital, and angels like Naval Ravikant, Jason Calacanis, Steve Huffman, and many others. The founders were both previously software engineers building products at scale at companies like Uber, Instacart, Flexport, and Checkr.

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!
