Our mission: Make cities more responsive, so they are safer, healthier, and more equitable for the people who live in them.

Numina makes a hardware and software platform that uses computer vision to help urban planners and municipal governments design better (safer) streets and public places. We sense bicycle, pedestrian, and other street traffic, and convert this data into real-time intelligence — without surveillance — to enable all sorts of partners in automation, autonomy, and development in the public right-of-way. We are looking for passionate people who would like to join us as we pursue our shared vision of more responsive cities.

As Numina’s Operations Intern, you will have the opportunity to participate in wide-ranging, confidential, and strategic tasks to support Numina’s business objectives and executive team. You should have an innate passion for learning, enjoy taking on new challenges and projects, and stay mindful of details in an energetic, fast-paced, and ever-changing environment. You will see many facets of business operations and project operations, with the opportunity to grow into a permanent, full-time role.

WHAT YOU WILL DO HERE:

  • Manage and track multiple projects simultaneously, proactively identifying gaps and inefficiencies while supporting your workers to deliver great customer experiences.
  • Design, build, and maintain work systems and processes to help maximize executives’ time, including weekly reporting, goal-tracking, and team meetings.
  • Navigate communications, calendars, and collaborations between the CEO, Numina’s team, and external stakeholders, customers, and vendors.
  • Demonstrate composure and flexibility, regardless of competing priorities.
  • Prepare agendas, materials, and notes for meetings and events.
  • Support various logistics and paperwork, from team travel to product order fulfillment to project roll-out, with impeccable attention to detail.
  • Remit, receive, and process various invoices, payments, and notifications in a timely manner, and flag any out-of-budget activities.

WHO YOU ARE:

  • 1+ years experience managing your own projects or programs.
  • Extraordinary organizational skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and computer skills including the ability to use Gmail, Google Docs/Sheets/Forms, Excel, Keynote/Powerpoint, and video conference tools.
  • Experience with, or willing to learn, a wide range of administrative support tasks and projects. Bonus: You have HRIS and/or Quickbooks experience.
  • Enthusiasm to deep-dive into any subject areas or tasks we need help with.
  • Ability to work independently and remotely.
  • Bonus: You have an eye for design and/or can use graphic design software.
  • Bonus: You care about cities and sustainability, transportation, privacy, and/or frontier technology.

WHO WE ARE:

We strive to be a team of positive, open-minded, respectful, resilient, dedicated, accountable, logical, creative, and empathetic people. We spend our days building an amazing product that makes a real difference in the world. We are a remote-first, distributed team, with an optional office in Brooklyn, New York. We are committed to seeking and sustaining diverse perspectives on our team.

We encourage you to apply if this role excites you, even if you think you may not meet all of the qualifications. At Numina, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

We are backed by investors including betaworks, Shasta Ventures, Elemental Excelerator, URBAN-X (MINI BMW), and accomplished entrepreneur-angels. Past projects have been supported by The Clinton Foundation, The Knight Foundation, and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation. We are a small, mission-driven company that is growing quickly. If you’d like to join our laser-focused and fast-paced team, we enthusiastically invite you to apply.

Who is Brown Bride?
Brown Bride is a marketplace to find South Asian wedding vendors in the US & Canada. We have over 800 vendors who specialize in everything from saree draping to henna design and hair & makeup. We are quickly becoming the biggest platform for brides to find South Asian vendors, and we’re excited to continue expanding into 2022.

Due to our amazing growth, we’re now looking to add another person to our team as our Social Media Coordinator.

What will you do?

  • Develop all creative content using tools such as Canva
  • Drive user engagement across all platforms (Instagram and Pinterest)
  • Manage social media content calendar using our scheduling tools
  • Write blog posts for our website www.thebrownbrideco.com
  • Respond to incoming queries on Instagram and triage internally
  • Develop and maintain an analytics dashboard to review with leadership team

What skills do you have?

  • A doer. You have exceptional follow-through and understand the level of work it takes to build a brand presence from the ground up
  • A relationship builder. Well-spoken and well-written. You are a clear and compelling communicator in person, and over email
  • Organized. You can juggle multiple projects at once and never forget to follow up. You know the smallest details can be the most important
  • Design aware. You know what looks good and what does not. You have an eye for design

Bonus:

  • Passionate about celebrating South Asian wedding culture, traditions and rituals
  • Excited to work at a female-led startup that is changing the way desi weddings are planned in the US

Compensation - We will pay $15/hour for the right candidate, and are open to students who wish to work part time. The minimum time commitment is 5 hours per week for at least 3 months.

How to apply

There are three ways you can apply for an internship at Brown Bride.

  • Writing Sample: Send us a 1-2 paragraph description of why you want to work at Brown Bride. Let us know why this position speaks to you!
  • Video Submission: Send us a 30-second video telling us about yourself and your prior experience. Think of it as an elevator pitch for you.
  • Creative Submission: Create an "advertisement" for Brown Bride that could be used within an Instagram Story - refer to our Instagram account @biancarods for inspiration

All applications must be submitted to info@thebrownbrideco.com with the subject line “Social Media Coordinator - [YOUR NAME]”

position: Startup Internship / Fellowship Program Biz Dev or Marketing
description:
Klatch 2021-2022 Academic Biz Dev or Marketing Fellowship

Klatch (formerly JobEcademy) is offering an exciting full year fellowship to work with a seasoned team to change the online learning landscape for millions of people. We’re looking for 4 highly talented undergraduate and graduate fellows from universities across the country to join our cohort for a part-time fellowship during the academic year (15-20 hours per week, October – May). Each week you’ll engage with a remarkable group of your peers while receiving the mentorship and training from an experienced startup team.

Help reimagine the world of online learning while learning the ins and outs of starting a business from a CEO and founder who has built and led many successful national companies. While this full-time internship is virtual, you’ll get constant face time with the team, stakeholders, & others to constantly be engaged, learning, and receive opportunities to drive projects that otherwise usually take years of being at a company for accelerated real life learning. Each year we receive hundreds of applicants for our fellowship training program. If you’re an ambitious, hard working student that is passionate about changing the landscape of online learning, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!

OUR ACADEMIC FELLOWSHIP ROLES:

We’re a fast-moving startup and looking for adaptable, coachable individuals who like to learn and do anything and everything. Roles will be flexible and adapted throughout the academic school year.

  • Business Development Do you love meeting new people? Figuring out their pain points & how you can help? In this role you’ll have the unique opportunity to reach out to subject matter experts, understand their journey, and share how we can solve their problems.
  • Marketing, & Social Media: Are you a social media aficionado? Do you enjoy sharing content, retweeting links and drumming up attention for happening? In this role you’ll help lead the company’s marketing and social media efforts and learn about best practice social media campaign design.

Please note that these are our current opportunities and constantly evolving. Let us know where your strengths, experience, and interests are. Fellows will fill many roles and work across many areas over the course of the academic year. We are a very small, nimble team.

ABOUT US:

Klatch is building the model for live, interactive group workshops for adults to learn nearly any topic from anywhere in the world. We believe lifelong learning is inherently social, not one-way pre-recorded hours of laborious videos. Our platform and model offers expert-led, community-based social learning. We enable experts across nearly any topic to stimulate an engaging classroom through an integrated cohort-based platform, social tools, and best in class facilitator training. We have no small dreams. We are on the path to transforming the world of adult education and have the experienced team and resources to do it. If you get excited by being part of a small team on the frontlines of disruption, Klatch might be the place for you!

ABOUT YOU:

Very strong attention to details, big picture, critical thinking, and problem solving skills
You leave your ego at the door, own your mistakes, and are solutions-focused.
Are fun to be around, excited by a small, fast-moving team, and able to wear many hats
Enjoy getting your hands dirty & passionate about solving the world’s biggest problems
You can work effectively remotely on your own and with a team over video calls.
Able to read & synthesize documents quickly, including complex data
Are self-driving and excited about managing up rather than being micro-managed
Have the skills and tenacity to thrive in ambiguous or challenging circumstances
Have a thirst to learn new skills and technologies, and can pick things up easily

WHY US:

Help reimagine adult learning while getting extensive experience building a business from the ground up from a CEO who has built successful national companies, led turnarounds and acquisitions, run national nonprofits with millions of members, and overseen multi-billion dollar programs at the highest levels of national government. We have an extraordinary group of world renowned advisors and investors that include: the earliest investors & founders of many global billion dollar marketplaces, executives responsible for massive global operations and logistics, marketing gurus who have established some of the world’s biggest brands, learning experts, educational foundations, large business networks, software and technical experts, legal and regulation experts and more. While a very small, fast-paced team we don’t take ourselves too seriously and have a lot of fun working together.

The Application Process:

This is an unpaid academic internship in partnership with your university. If selected for our year long cohort, you will have a professor sign our internship agreement (some students have elected to also get credit through their university but this is not required). Include in your cover letter the top 3 specific role(s) you are most interested in, your earliest available start date and latest end date, that you understand a professor will sign off on the program, and any background experience that might be applicable. All Fellows will go through a similar training program while roles will be considerably different depending on prior experience and capabilities.

*Dates & Details: *

This fellowship will run continuously (aside from breaks) from early September to end of May at 15-20 hours per week with some flexibility when those hours are done. Only apply if you can consistently dedicate at least 15 hours per week during weekdays. You will report to senior team leaders with regular interaction with the CEO.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

NOTE: Although Epoch Games does have a formal office at the listed address, we have a fully-online team at this time. Communication is mostly done via Slack (an instant messaging application) and Trello (an online project collaboration tool).

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be working closely with other members of the Coding department to develop C++ code for the Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). Keep in mind that we are using Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) to develop the game, and knowledge of how C++ code interacts with UE4 is required. Knowledge of Blueprint scripting in UE4 is recommended, but not required.

Communication is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members and not be afraid to ask should any problems arise. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

If you are comfortable with teaching, you may be called upon to aid the more junior members of the team in any relevant area.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with) and following team policies.

REQUIREMENTS

Minimum Requirements:

  • C++ programming experience
  • Unreal Engine 4 experience, and how C++ code interacts with it
  • Providing clear and legible code
  • Online communication and Team-collaboration skills
  • A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games

Recommended Requirements:

  • Git Experience
  • Blueprint scripting experience
  • At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++ code) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment at the interview.

Required Software:

  • Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register)
  • Visual Studio Community Edition (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/) with Unreal Engine packages

Job Headline (Note: this is a paid internship)

This is an incredible paid Sales Intern opportunity with the potential to receive a full-time offer to be an SDR at a top healthcare startup in NYC. Come learn with us!

About Us

Medmo is revolutionizing the world of medical imaging. Imaging diagnostics is often the first meaningful step in identifying the right treatments and preventative care for patients. Getting this right is so important, and in today’s world it’s not always easy and accessible. We’re here to change that.

Medmo gives patients access to more affordable care at local top centers through it’s convenient and easy to use platform. We mitigate wasted capacity with imaging providers and remove administrative burden for referring physicians through our seamless scheduling and follow-up process. Most importantly, our mission is to empower patients to take better control of their healthcare, and to give providers the tools they need for better outcomes.

It’s an exciting time at Medmo! Backed by some of New York’s top investors, we’re currently in growth mode, and we’re looking for the next wave of top talent to help us grow our footprint within the United States.

The Role

The Sales Intern position is an exciting first step into the world of sales, centered around research, targeting and prioritization of potential physician users.

  • Research physician practices to see who might be a good potential fit for Medmo’s services
  • Support the sales team in crafting strategic targets for specific territories in the United States
  • Learn the ins and outs of Medmo’s CRM and physician management systems

We are seeking yoga students who are passionate about their practice and who possess a deep desire to expand their yogic knowledge. This is not a paid position. This role was created for a yogi looking for an alternative way to fund their own training . . . with the leading, global, yoga teacher training company. If the price of a high-quality training has kept you from pursuing your dream, this program was created just for you!

Evolation provides personal and transformational yoga teacher training in California, New York, Hawaii, Italy, Norway, Bali, Thailand, Costa Rica, Peru, Australia, and more. We travel the globe to reach students, and students from all over the globe love traveling with us to beautiful destinations to immerse themselves in “all things yoga”. Our trainings are designed to help students undergo a physical, mental and emotional transformation. Our training specialties are Hot 26, Vinyasa and Yin. We offer 250 hour and a 500 hour Yoga Alliance accredited teaching certifications. Evolation has conducted over 120 trainings and has established a worldwide network of yoga students, teachers, and studios working together to fuel everyone's growth. The opportunities within this network include: travelling yoga teachers, training chefs, training assistants and senior trainers, studio management, sales, marketing, and more.

Want to learn more about evolation and consider the opportunity to help us deepen our reach and bring awareness to our training opportunities?

Get started by reviewing our web site: evolationyoga.com

If you sense a potential match with your training goals and desires, ditch the resume and apply with the following . . .

• Your yoga story. How long have you been practicing? What styles of yoga do you prefer? How has yoga changed you – mind/body/spirit? Why do you seek teacher training? Why do you think evolation might be a good fit for you?
• Your other “gigs” – are you a student, a professional, a free spirit, a stay at home parent?
• Name of the studio(s) you practice in and/or any other information that may help us understand your networking capability with yogis (including social media).
• Your name, location, and a contact phone number.

The evolation ambassador program is a generous program for earning your training completely free or deeply discounted. You’ll have the opportunity to decide when and where to “cash in” for training. The right candidate will also have the opportunity to earn free airfare to their location of choice.

Brad’s Deals is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. Through this, we want to ensure that all people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Candidates that are differently-abled will not be discriminated against throughout the application, interviewing, or hiring process. Reasonable accommodations are needed in order to complete the hiring process, essential job functions, and/or to receive other privileges or benefits of employment will be addressed during the recruitment process. In this position, this candidate will need to perceive the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and have the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound.

Our Story
Brad’s Deals continues to save consumers over $200 million a year by sharing the best deals out there all while being the safest place to shop on Earth®. We live out our core values with a ‘Consumer’s first, always’ mindset to deliver the most value every day.

Started by Brad in 2001, our purpose remains the same to help create smarter shopping habits and to keep it real with expert lifestyle and financial advice.

Our culture embraces diversity with different talents, experiences, and backgrounds that help us be exceptional together. With competitive pay, full health benefits, 401K match, plenty of paid time off including a paid sabbatical, and creative perks, we also believe in work-life integration and continued learning.

As one of the 50 Best Places to Work, located in the heart of Chicago’s River North neighborhood, we partner with over 2,500 retailers to help 5.5 million consumers save more every month. So if you want to challenge the ordinary and love what you do, we want to hear from you.

Brad’s Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion
'Embrace diversity’ is one of our core values because our differences make us stronger together. To make the world a more inclusive and safe place, we start within our company to intentionally lead with equal opportunities. We encourage the value that unique talents, ethnicities, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences bring to our company, our employees, and our future applicants. We welcome all applicants, whether or not you meet every qualification, to share your unique talents with us.

"Love what you do" and our Commitment to your Personal Growth
At Brad’s Deals, our culture invites creativity, passion, and career empowerment to help you thrive. We champion employees to create their personal paths to success and are proud to be above the industry average in employee promotions earned every year. An entrepreneurial spirit supports our commitment to employee growth and being exceptional together with unique talents, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences.

*Please note: Due to the potential personal and business impacts of Covid-19, Brad's Deals is taking a proactive approach by allowing our employees to work from home. As such, our hiring teams will be conducting virtual interviews with potential candidates as we continue to monitor the effects of the pandemic across our local community.

What if you help big corporations not only source for crops based on their quality specifications to save time and money, but also provide accelerated invoice settlements to ease cash flow?

Zowasel works alongside local growers to sustainably produce high-quality harvests to provide healthy food for all. The company then connects growers and buyers directly to bring these harvests to market. Working across the supply chain, Zowasel is forwarding its mission of sustainable crop quality standardization, access to markets that result in a more transparent, fair, and increased revenue for growers.

Currently, we are looking for various Key Account Specialists, to drive Zowasel’s market entry strategy in Nigeria. This role will immediately identify target processors/buyers and promote Zowasel innovative services and digital technologies, as well as promoting Zowasel Marketplace and Certified Crop. Key Account Managers will work rather independently while our team provides adequate support and guidance.

This role will be the primary sales and service touchpoint for our buyer customers. They represent Zowasel and are well versed in all Zowasel value propositions and will be able to execute with the clear objective of supporting the buyers in business decisions to help improve supply chain efficiency and purchase profitability. Customer experience is core to the success of these team members in a quest to develop “enterprise” buyer customers.

The role of the Key Account Specialist is to build and maintain close, emotional relationships with Zowasel’s enterprise customers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Serves as a primary relationship manager for buyer-customers and leads a buyer-facing team of Subject Matter Experts
  • Takes overall market and business development accountability within the predefined area in Nigeria
  • Establish a network of processors and millers buyers as a target customer list
  • Organize buyers meeting events to present Zowasel and its solutions and digital technologies, as well as its Marketplace and Certified Crop opportunities
  • Design locally adapted value proposition and business models that accelerate Zowasel technology adoption
  • Partners with buyer customers resulting in their adopting Zowasel solutions (financial, digital technologies, Marketplace, and Certified Crop)
  • Identifies and operationally manages crop quality specifications and partners supply chain expectations
  • Follow up through the season until harvest to assess product yield uplift
  • Promote Zowasel MarketplaceTM Zowasel Certified CropTM as part of Zowasel overall offer within target buyer customers
  • Support development of a network of feed mills as MarketplaceTM buyers within their own area
  • Support design of scale-up strategy and the assessment of distribution partners
  • Stay aligned with business unit direction and team
  • Maintains buyer accounts, sales stages, important notes, and sales process information in CRM tool and utilizes other sales enablement technologies provided to them
  • Have a developed a book of business such that repeat transactions become the norm and we are on track to be transacting 65%+ of each buyer’s grain through Marketplace
  • Interact with 100% of assigned leads
  • Able to respond to new leads within 24 hours (1 business day)
  • Build a book of business (from warm, qualified leads) that are increasingly using Marketplace and other Zowasel products
  • Attributes and Competencies
  • Strong self-starter, comfortable in rapidly changing and entrepreneurial agtech start-up environment
  • Commercially minded, sales-results oriented, highly confident, deal closer
  • High energy, positive attitude, goal-getter, never-give-up mindset
  • Passionate about agriculture, crop production, and sustainability
  • Good understanding of cropping practices, seed genetics, and downstream mill quality/ value drivers
  • Open-minded to new ways and digital technologies that shape the future of agriculture
  • Very comfortable discussing business in front of buyers, growers, financial partners, and agronomy technical advisors
  • Strong record-keeping, organizational, and multitasking skills
  • It is highly preferable that a candidate brings a strong network of growers within their target area
  • Willingness to work flexible hours to align with customer convenience
  • Ability to manager a large portfolio of buyers
  • Strong Phone skills-ability to develop long term, trusting relationships over the phone
  • Familiar with agribusiness industry products, Minimum Price Contracts, etc.
  • Experience selling in a team environment
  • Analytical and Smart
  • Ability to quickly develop relationships with someone over the phone
  • High energy
  • Flexible in mindset and approach
  • Ambitious and successful – the high internal drive
  • Strong farm and agribusiness acumen
  • High ability to use new software and continually learn new functions
  • High integrity, ownership, and accountability
  • Someone who we would want to be in a room with all-day under high pressure
  • Ability to sell successfully in a high growth company

Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Preferred degrees: Agribusiness, Agronomy, Marketing, Finance, and Business, or similar
  • Roles dealing directly with enterprise processors
  • The ideal candidate has a strong experience in grain marketing and sales within the Nigerian market, candidates with outstanding sales or technical agribusiness background also considered
  • 1+ years of Cash Grain experience
  • 1+ years of Salesforce or a CRM system, or equivalent skills required
  • 1+ years of Production Ag, Grain Marketing experience
  • Previous experience and current knowledge about maize and soybean, specifically
  • Nigerian native languages (Hausa, Yoruba, etc), strong English skills
  • Experience with QMS systems is a plus
  • Experience with Agriculture science work is plus

About Zowasel
Zowasel is a company dedicated to sustainable crop quality standardization, access to markets that result in a more transparent, fair, and increase revenue for growers. With a vision of creating a world where farming is an economically desirable career and profitable profession. INTERNATIONAL VOLUNTEERING INTERNSHIP IN AN INTERNATIONAL FEDERATION
Human Connection Economy 4.0 (HCE 4)

Description: Virtual Internship

Length: Three to six months

Location: Toronto (Canada). Remote working.

HCE 4 Headquarters: Villeurbanne, Lyon, France, European Union

HCE 4: HCE 4 is a professional, international and innovative federation that accompanies organisations and businesses that wish to migrate towards the 4th Industrial Revolution (also known as Economy 4.0). HCE 4 services integrate new concepts for management and marketing through putting the human, human connection and the planet at the heart of companies; and all around them through their clients. This is the Human Connection Economy 4.0. We are a Social Business that have just launched, seeking to become a part of the Fourth Sector. And we are in our start-up phase. Our outlook is global and we are specifically focussed on North America, Europe, Latin America and Asia. You can find more information about us at www.hce4.com.

Internship Objectives (to be finalised during the on-boarding process):

  • Develop short videos (trailers, Youtube series, etc.)
  • Develop long videos (conferences, training, etc.).

  • Assist with the filming of interviews and with video training.
  • Very motivating, diverse and innovative missions.

Student Profile:

  • Undergraduate/Masters student who has strong online competences.
  • Additional languages than English are appreciated but not compulsory.
  • Good command of one or more image and sound editing software.
  • Good command of Office (Word/Excel/Power Point) and have access to this on their own laptop.
  • Very autonomous and independent – a fast learner.
  • It is not necessary to have existing knowledge of new technology, human management, or human marketing as this knowledge will be developed through training with HCE 4.
  • Ability to work full-time during the period of your missions.

Who we are

Halo Incubator is a NYC based incubator for women founded companies. Halo was founded in 2018 in an effort to help close the gap in the education, mentorship and resources female entrepreneurs receive.

Halo’s programming provides founders with key frameworks and networks to help them grow their businesses. Our multi-week cohort spans everything from Customer Discovery and Product Market Fit to Public Speaking Best Practices and Pitching Investors. In addition to presentations and lectures given by our team, we bring in guest speakers with specialized knowledge and industry connections. Halo also offers one-off workshops dedicated to industry-specific skills that many founders need guidance on.

Position overview

This is a part-time remote internship working with the founders of Halo Incubator on scaling the accelerator program in terms of educational programming, partnerships and expansion across the U.S. through virtual learning.

We are looking for a marketer or someone passionate about working in marketing and entrepreneurship to join a mission driven organization focused on women’s financial opportunities, and building the next big accelerator program!

Key focus of the internship is around partnership strategy, research and design around programming, and marketing projects including content, social media and PR. A bonus skill to have would be experience in design tools such as Canva or Adobe Photoshop.

This is an opportunity for someone to get more familiar with how an accelerator program operates and to get more familiar with the investing ecosystem, especially in NYC. It’s also an opportunity for someone interested in both VC and entrepreneurship to get a behind-the-scenes look at both sides of the innovation landscape.

This is a part-time (10hrs/week) internship lasting approximately 10 weeks. This is unpaid and ideal for those looking to get experience in entrepreneurship and learn about venture capital and accelerators.

Responsibilities:

  • Managing marketing initiatives including keeping content calendar up-to-date, research topics of blogs and other content, and some light social media management
  • Research, generate leads and outreach to potential strategic partners, including corporates, and venture capital firms
  • Assisting in design of educational programming for virtual events that take place and helping book guest speakers, and managing communications and logistics
  • Assisting with summer and fall cohort programming, member management and guest speaker scheduling

Halo Incubator is an equal opportunity employer and strongly encourages applications from people of color, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ applicants.

Please send resume and 1 paragraph on why you'd like to work with us (no cover letters please) to info@haloincubator.com

Please note: US applicants only

InstaHub is teaching students how to identify/calculate/address building energy waste on campuses across the country through our Sustainability Campus Ambassador Program at no cost.

Disclaimer: This *remote** position can start anytime in September/October 2021 and continue through January/February 2022 or longer if available. This is an unpaid internship opportunity, that will require 5 - 10 hours/week commitment. Visa sponsorship is not available.*

OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOU!

You will have the opportunity to work with a team on your campus and InstaHub's team to plan, communicate, secure funding (e.g. crowdfund, sustainability grants), deploy, and evaluate the project (detailed below) for your own school. We have domain expertise and proven experience to help your team achieve similar successes. Our data scientists' insights will teach your team about the specificity of the energy-saving opportunities regardless of your prior knowledge. All local news and public relation opportunities that will come up will focus on YOUR team's effort for leading YOUR school's climate action commitment. Plus, this will also be a great resume builder.

WHAT WILL YOU LEARN?

-How to digest your school's climate action plan goals.
-How to conduct an intermediate-level building energy audit.
-How to successfully fundraise (e.g. crowdfunding, grants, etc.)
-Soft Skills (e.g. time management, teamwork, public speaking, problem-solving, critical thinking, etc.)
-Business skills (e.g. project management, stakeholder analysis, marketing/PR, impact modelling, etc.)

Apply: Get Involved Now: Google Form Submission

VISION

Eliminate global energy waste.

MISSION

Use artificial intelligence to save money and energy without replacing expensive building equipment.

INTRO

InstaHub is a sustainability-tech startup with a triple bottom line business model started by students at the University of Pennsylvania in 2016 helping campuses across the U.S. build climate change awareness, sharing free energy-saving tips, and using accessible artificial intelligence to combat persistent and invisible energy waste across buildings. InstaHub is teaching students how to identify/calculate/address energy waste on campuses across the country through our Sustainability Campus Ambassador Program.

FOCUS

Why focus on buildings? Building accounts for 40% of global carbon emissions and 97% of US buildings consistently bleed out unused energy. $1+ trillion of energy in the US alone is wasted every 5 years. School buildings are mostly owner operated with an immense amount of energy waste while students are eager to learn how to make a sustainable impact and support campus Climate Action Plans.

PROBLEM
We believe existing data loggers and automation solutions are overpriced, obscure, difficult to install, and require too many steps to extract useful insights/recommendations causing limited adoption for the facility management industry. Saving energy should not cost an arm and a leg nor should it be rocket science!

(real anonymous energy saving projects requiring 20-40 years payback period)

PILOT OBJECTIVE
We have deployed and will continue to deploy "instant plug-n-play" 5-in-1 sensor data loggers, "Instaloggers", into buildings collecting 5 sensor data points per room about its operational & environmental conditions (e.g. space utilization, temperature, humidity, pressure, light, etc.) over time. Each building has multiple floors, rooms, room types, users, schedules, and operational uses. Let’s make AI more turnkey to save energy!

Our objectives are:

1) Provide an instant plug-n-play data collection of occupancy + environmental sensors (Phase 1)
2) Provide easy to read visualization and analysis of the data (Phase 2)
3) Automate energy waste pattern detection and segmentation (Phase 3)
4) Automate the prioritization of actionable insights/recommendations (Phase 4)

OUTCOME: To ultimately help building/energy managers update BMS/RTU/VAV Box/Thermostatic setback schedules and/or lighting schedules using AI-driven and occupancy-based pattern recognition, saving tens of thousands of dollars (achieving 1-3 year payback periods).

IMPACT

You can help your school save $2,000 - $20,000/year from energy waste per building (50-150k kwh/year savings or 150,000 pounds of CO2 Emissions.) We will teach you how to calculate the impact leveraging tools like EPA’s Greenhouse Gas Equivalencies Calculator. InstaHub's Sustainability Campus Ambassador Program will make it accessible for you to contribute to high-impact energy-saving projects (that do not need to take decades to see the impact of your efforts) to tackle climate change as buildings contribute to 40% of energy-related carbon dioxide emissions.

InstaHub's Sustainability Campus Ambassador Program will make it accessible for you to contribute to high-impact energy-saving projects (that do not need to take decades to see the impact of your efforts) to tackle climate change as buildings contribute to 40% of energy-related carbon dioxide emissions.

PROGRAM SCHEDULE

  1. InstaHub partners with 3 Students + 1 College Staff Advisor (Sustainability/Facilities/Faculty)
  2. InstaHub teaches students about building energy waste (what/where/when/how/why)
  3. Students identify building energy waste examples (InstaHub + admin advise)
  4. Students plan pilot (InstaHub + admin advise)
  5. Students fundraise for Phase 1 funding (InstaHub + admin advise)
  6. InstaHub will teach students how to launch crowdfund for initiative (Step 1)
  7. InstaHub sends box of preconfigured plug-n-play sensors (Instaloggers)
  8. Students deploy sensors in pilot building/s (InstaHub + admin advise)
  9. Students analyze energy waste data + offer recommendations (Save $2-20k/yr./bldg.)
  10. Students + InstaHub promote success of initiative on Social Media/Newsletter/Newsoutlet
  11. Students apply for Sustainability Grant for Phase 2 larger funding for 5-10 building pilot
  12. Students present case-study to sustainability/facilities/student population
  13. If grant gets approved, student + facilities team prepare/deploy scaled pilot

Note: The duration of InstaHub's Sustainability Campus Ambassador Program can range from 1-3 months or last longer depending on school structures.

PennyFly Entertainment is a by-artists-for-artists entertainment company offering some of the best deal structures in the industry for unsigned artists in addition to a unique and flexible label services model. PennyFly has been named among Pepperdine University's "Most Fundable Companies" as a semi-finalist going into 2021, the first record label to be recognized in this capacity.

PennyFly has a current opening for the role of Artist Marketing Coordinator. This position can be fulfilled 100% remotely from anywhere in the United States with opportunities for in-person involvement if desired/local to the greater Los Angeles region.

This role will be involved in all aspects of artist marketing from strategy inception to carrying out promotional campaigns. Time expense will fluctuate (7-14 hours/week) depending on the project and promotional phase. Reports directly to senior management team. Industry-specific training will be provided, but a passion and expertise with social media marketing at a minimum is required.

Strategy, Product, and Operations Associate
Internship or senior year co-op
Boston/Cambridge, MA or remote

About Upped
Upped Events is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) FinTech startup that uses data, digital logistics, and a hint of consumer psychology to enhance the events industry. Our platform is a complete event ecosystem designed to boost event profits and enhance the attendee experience by streamlining event management in one, data-connected system. From initial event marketing to partner settlement, Upped facilitates mobile payments, event administration, and real-time data analytics, using AI to generate personalized 'nudges' to attendees that help identify interesting experiences, maximize spend, shorten lines, boost safety, & more. A prior Wharton Business Plan Competition semi-finalist, Upped was recently designated by Startupbootcamp as a top-20 up-and-coming EventTech company after winning Cambridge Innovation Center’s 3675 competition.

Your Role
Upped is currently looking for an Operations, Product, and Strategy (O.P.S.) Associate to assist the executive team with a diverse set of projects ranging from developing product roadmaps, to strategic financial analysis, and pre-event logistics planning. This position will serve as the “right hand” to Upped’s COO (a Wharton MBA and former BCG Project Leader) and will have significant senior leadership exposure. Depending on the candidate, part-time time commitment is possible as long as it leads to full-time in the future.

The successful candidate will serve as a thought partner and executor, helping to develop critical product enhancements while defining major strategic initiatives. Consequently, this position will carry substantial responsibility and have significant opportunity for advancement and growth. Ideal for someone intellectually curious and with varied professional interests, the position will be one-part strategy consulting, one-part product management, and one-part operational planning, all in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.

While Upped’s employees currently work remotely, we’re hoping to be back in an office or have occasional meet-ups in early 2022 (and so will prioritize candidates in the Boston area, but will consider permanently remote candidates too).

About You
You will need to thrive in a fast-paced and complex atmosphere, be comfortable with ambiguity, and have sound judgement and critical thinking skills. The successful candidate will also be organized and detail oriented, self-motivated, and maintain a can-do attitude with a willingness to pitch in wherever needed.

Product, strategy, and operations experience is not necessary to succeed in this role; the executive team is looking for the right team member and is willing to invest time in training, mentoring, and developing you. We’re looking for someone smart and driven, a great problem solver (especially with ambiguous and undefined problems), and always eager to learn something new. We move fast at Upped; while the executive team is relaxed, client expectations can demand quick responses to problems and candidates should excel with tight turnarounds and (manageable) pressure.

*Duties & responsibilities may include: *

Project work:
• Evaluating the product roadmap and strategic opportunities to prioritize options and inform company direction; candidate may help define the roadmap for specific modules within the product suite
• Refining business strategy, including pricing, operating model, sales, and organizational strategy
• Drafting and evaluating options to solve operational/logistic challenges for clients
• Conducting market, competitive, and customer research to assist with internal decision making
• Managing project workflows and tools (e.g., ClickUp)
• Product testing and reviewing changes as implemented by the Development team
• Analyzing and offering recommendations for various miscellaneous projects (e.g., valuing/evaluating the feasibility of an opportunity, synthesizing desk research, etc.)
• Preparing investor documents as Upped works with VCs and other investor groups
• Pitching in to help with operations and other related business tasks on an ad-hoc basis, as needs arise

Business responsibilities:
• Bringing big ideas to the table, obtaining buy-in, and effectively and efficiently implementing ideas within the context of Upped’s chosen organizational infrastructure
• Keeping communicative, actively engaged, and detail oriented so as to produce quality work and update management. Regular communications and check-ins will be expected.

• Acting as a driver of change by proactively identifying opportunities, methods, and solutions to drive improvement in Upped’s processes
• Being present at all company-wide meetings to ensure opportunities, challenges, and ongoing accountability against company benchmarks
• Post-COVID, we expect there to be (optional) opportunities to attend and support events around the country

• Potential to help manage interns or other staff as the candidate progresses
• Learning. At Upped we support you in any way that we can – if you’re looking for other opportunities to grow, just ask for them

Basic qualifications and character traits
• A bachelor's degree (or current enrollment with less than 12 months to graduate), ideally from a top-tier university studying business, marketing, economics, math/stats, data science, or other quantitative field, though all qualified candidates and fields of study will be considered
• Ability to break down complex subjects into easy-to-understand concepts using clear verbal/written English
• Desire and ability to work autonomously and ability to juggle multiple projects at once
• Enthusiasm for a startup environment and an optimistic energy that pushes you to want to make a difference
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel), Google Drive/email/calendar, & general web research
• Strong critical thinking and decision-making skills supported by research/quantitative reasoning/sound judgement
• Able to prioritize, execute, and take initiative in a complex/fast-paced environment
• A high degree of emotional intelligence, tact, patience, and detail orientation
• Ability to work permanently in the US without sponsorship

Preferred qualifications
• Experience with strategy, product management or development, consulting, finance, or business operations
• Experience in (or passion for) the festival / conference / entertainment / ticketing / event industries, including attending events and an interest in their operations
• Familiarity with mobile apps and other leading-edge software applications (Slack, Zoom, Insta, SC, FB, etc.)

Additional Information
• This is an unpaid position, with the potential for a full-time salaried position at the end of it depending on performance
• To apply, please send a resume and cover letter explaining why you would be a good fit for the position to careers@uppedevents.com, with “O.P.S. Associate” in the subject line

Please direct any questions or concerns to mark@uppedevents.com

About the company
Upped is an enhanced mobile payment and attendee engagement solution that provides event owners with automated tools to measure and manage every stakeholder at an event -- attendees, staff, managers, vendors, and sponsors -- through the use of:
1) a hardware-free mobile payment and event management app

Your Role
Upped Events is looking for a Research Business Analyst to assist with researching the market, its potential customers, and how the startup will approach launch in Q3 2021. Primary responsibilities will involve internet research, information organization, using excel to frame certain information, and discussing findings with Upped’s executives. The goal of this position is to support the CEO and his team in their efforts to bring a one-of-a-kind event management solution to the post-COVID event market. Interns will also have the opportunity to work with Upped’s advisors, and -- depending on the skillset of the analyst -- the CEO will ask him/her to join customer interviews and sales conversations.

Upped is looking for individual(s) eager to join a positive, fast paced, mentor-oriented start-up environment and assist “product launch” efforts in a multitude of ways. The internship would be tailored to fit the candidate’s particular interests and skill set, with weekly hours and duration of internship negotiable based on candidate’s availability and preferences.

*Responsibilities: *

We are looking for candidates with experience and/or interest in any of the following:

*Product Design/UI/UX Intern*

About Upped
Upped Events is a SaaS Fintech startup that uses AI-constructed engagements to measure and manage every stakeholder at an event (attendees, staff, managers, vendors, the event owner, sponsors, etc). Using attendee smartphones, Upped’s software-only infrastructure can scale to any event size, use-case, or format. Real-time event data is combined with external data sources and analyzed by its AI model to maximize engagement opportunities that can be provided to the event owner or each attendee individually. While beta-testing its predecessor’s mobile payment prototype, Upped achieved ‘average attendee spend’ numbers as high as 115% over those attendees without Upped. A prior Wharton Business Plan Competition semi-finalist, Upped was recently designated by Startupbootcamp as a top-20 up-and-coming EvenTech company after winning Cambridge Innovation Center’s 3675 competition. The company’s Phase 1 product will be completed by the end of October 2020, during which time the company will be raising investment, growing its management team, and refining its AI offering.

Your Role
Upped is currently looking for a Product Design/UI/UX Intern to assist in the design and user experience planning for various features of our profuct. This will include incorporating current designs into each new product feature, understanding the customer it is intended for, and creating mockups/wireframes that Upped's in-house developers can turn into product. A big part of this is a UI / "how this feature looks" reviews. This individual would work under guidance from the COO, CTO, and other corporate personnel in a virtual work environment.

This individual will be joining a lean and growing startup, so will need to thrive in a fast-paced and complex environment, be organized and detail oriented, and maintain a can-do attitude with a willingness to pitch in wherever needed. They must be particularly capable in the graphical creation side of UI/UX design. Following the internship, Upped will work with these individuals to assess whether there is a match for a full-time position or consultation opportunities, and is happy to provide a strong recommendation letter for future employment.

Duties and responsibilities will include:

  • Working collaboratively with Upped’s CEO, COO, CTO, developers, and graphic designers to understand business objectives, needs, processes, design standards, and optimal consumer experiences for Upped’s technology
  • Creating industry-informed UI of existing features and mockups/prototypes/wireframes for existing and upcoming features of the product to ensure an optimal user experience from event stakeholders (attendees, vendors, event owner, speakers, etc)
  • Developing creative designs improvements for the website, mobile site, social media posts, or other software within the company
  • Keeping communicative, actively engaged, and detail oriented so as to produce quality work
  • Being present at all company-wide meetings to escalate opportunities and challenges, while pushing for ongoing accountability and structure
  • Learn. At Upped we support you in any way that we can – if you’re looking for something else, just ask Mark.

  • Experience with Figma or some other similar prototyping software
  • Project management skills including creative problem solving, multi-tasking, and meeting deadlines
  • Being up-to-date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies
  • Desire and ability to work autonomously and ability to juggle multiple projects at once
  • Enthusiasm for a startup environment and an optimistic energy that pushes you to excel for the sake of making a difference
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Drive/email, and general web research
  • Strong decision-making skills supported by research/quantitative reasoning
  • Out of the box thinking, emotional intelligence, creativity, and tact are essential

Other valued qualifications

  • Experience with usability tools like After Efects, Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
  • Experience in the festival/conference/entertainment/ticketing/event industries
  • Detail oriented with a healthy dose of cost/benefit reasoning (your time and attention are valuable)

Company Overview

Pareto Care is a medical device company developing a wearable biosensor platform to measure hemodynamic parameters important to the management of many clinical conditions including heart failure. Our products are reliable, affordable and designed with a core focus on user experience. Our team is driven to develop products that will change the way patients and clinicians manage health outcomes. We are dedicated to the personal and professional growth of all our team members and strive to create a positive and creative work environment. The Biomedical Engineering Intern will join our Research & Development Team. This internship will allow you the opportunity to work on multiple projects including but not limited to sensor design, sensor development, and sensor validation. You would play a crucial role in the design and development of our biosensors. You will be conducting research aimed at obtaining a comprehensive understanding of cardiac functions, hemodynamics, ECG, bioimpedance and tissue optics.

We want this internship to be a holistic and rewarding experience for you! We want to help you take the next step in your career as a biomedical engineer. We believe the best engineers don’t just bring a wealth of knowledge to the table, but a structured problem solving approach to research and development that is centered around the objective. Join us in our journey to improve patient outcomes while keeping them outside the hospital.

Responsibilities

  • Conducting extensive research on impedance cardiography and electrocardiogram technology
  • Exploring various electronic components for development and verification of sensor designs
  • Solving design and development challenges at the intersection of hemodynamics, electronics and optics
  • Communicating research findings with the R&D team

Required Skills

  • Ability to work with a cross-functional team
  • Knowledge of human physiology and hemodynamics
  • Ability to solve complex multidisciplinary problems
  • Ability to foresee challenges and come up with potential solutions
  • Ability to communicate complex scientific research in simple terms

Desired Experience

  • Pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Biomedical Engineering or similar discipline
  • Previous research experience working with Hemodynamics or Electrocardiogram or Impedance Cardiography
  • Previous experience designing and conducting experiments

position: Clocky Architecture / Industrial Design Internship for Consumer Home Brand
description:
DESCRIPTION

We're a popular consumer products company building the innovative products for the home! One of our biggest products is Clocky, the popular alarm clock that runs away beeping. Check us out at www.clocky.com. We are launching a larger umbrella consumer brand, and working on an innovative model home in Los Angeles, California.

We are designing new products for launch as part of this new model home. Does the idea of growing with a company that creates highly innovative consumer products, becoming a critical member of its team appeal to you? Our interns only work on projects that will be used in the real world.

You will gain valuable experience working with our senior team. We are ultimately looking for students that have an interest in innovation, creativity, may also be entrepreneurial. and of course smart and hungry to learn!

LEARNING OBJECTIVES:

  • The student will build custom products for the model home (some are furniture based, some lighting based, and some are tech based consumer goods)
  • Source materials and gather information to choose the best options based on cost, implementation, and other factors
  • If designed modeling/3D sketching design portfolio.
  • This training is similar to a high level design or branding college class.
  • The student will receive mentor-ship from our CEO and Creative Director
  • The student will be able to sit in on team meetings and contribute ideas to high level development.
  • They are welcome to contribute their own ideas. -The student can gain experience in a field relevant to their major -The student will develop their professional communication skills and receive resume and cover letter support. We also provide fantastic recommendation letters at your request.

SKILLS:

-Architecture / Design

  • 3D Modeling a plus (though not required)
  • Sketching
  • Product Design a plus

TO APPLY:

Please include the below information and provide a few sentences of what you seek in an internship and what drew you to Clocky. Also, send your portfolio link and a resume in PDF form to diana@clocky.com

a) What is your earliest start date, and what is your end date?
b) How many hours would you like to work per week?
c) This is a mostly remote position for the time being. Can you use your own laptop (or other equipment as needed), wifi connection/software?
d) Tell us a bit about your experience and skills as it relates to this position (and include portfolio if relevant).
e) This internship is unpaid, eventually, unpaid for college credit, if your university accepts this modality. Is that okay with you?

We're a popular consumer products company building the innovative products for the home! One of our biggest products is Clocky, the popular alarm clock that runs away beeping. Check us out at www.clocky.com and new products you work on will be part of our larger umbrella consumer brand.

About bird&be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customer's optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.

We are a very early stage startup, and are building a brilliant team that is excited to help solve this complex problem.

The Opportunity

As a Software Developer Intern, you’ll be working on the frontend/backend or both, of our web application and eCommerce store. You'll be working very closely with the senior developer, and our designers on a day-to-day basis.

Over the course of the internship, you will have the opportunity to do and learn various things such as :

  • Deploying changes to production on a regular basis
  • Building out new components and features in React
  • Polishing our store presence on BigCommerce via native Javascript, HTML and SCSS
  • Performing code reviews, bug fixes, and writing tests
  • Building out new logic for our recommendations algorithms in NextJS
  • Learning tips and tricks needed to make an online store successful through SEO Optimization, Performance Monitoring, and Error Reporting

Is this the right fit?

  • Currently enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary program and looking for an 4 or 8 month internship starting the Winter 2022 Term.
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada (no sponsorships)
  • Full Time only, no part-time
  • You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that is having a massive impact on people's lives. You are self motivated, love to collaborate, and resourceful.
  • We are dealing with a very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high.
  • You’re looking to take responsibility and ownership of a product, that you’ll have a big impact on from the onset
  • You’re comfortable working with minimal oversight and direct management

The Skillset

  • Experience with HTML, CSS is required
  • Familiarity with JavaScript is preferred
  • Experience with React/Next.JS is a nice to have
  • 1 or more completed internships is preferred

The Current Tech Stack

  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • BigCommerce (E-Commerce Platform)
  • NextJS
  • React
  • SCSS
  • Github Actions
  • Vercel

The Interview Process

  • Virtual Chat with our Senior Developer
  • Take home Challenge OR an Existing Project Review
  • Challenge/Project Review with the Developer
  • Meeting with COO &; CEO
  • Offer

Any Questions?

Have more questions? Feel free to reach us at jobs@birdandbe.com.

The Bird&Be Story

We've walked this fertility journey too.

We've experienced first hand how frustrating the fertility journey can be, and there are a lot of things we wish we knew sooner. For starters, it’s not that easy, but also, there are lots of things you can do to optimize your body for success.

We offer fertility-supporting products and services to help you do just that, without leaving your home and no matter what stage of the journey you’re in.

All of this will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different than the current "family planning" aisles filled with blue and white boxes, plastered with photos of white babies on them. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Glossier and Knix.

Bird&Be is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please don’t hesitate to reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

Salary
$20 - 30 CAD /hr

The Bird&Be Story

We've walked this fertility journey too.

We've experienced first hand how frustrating the fertility journey can be, and there are a lot of things we wish we knew sooner. For starters, it’s not that easy, but also, there are lots of things you can do to optimize your body for success.

We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

Our mission

Boom is on a mission to level the playing field for the 110+ million renters in the US by making housing more flexible, affordable, and attainable. We’re starting by building a payment app that enables renters to pay their rent how they want, on the schedule they define, and get rewarded in the process. We are led by a team of second-time founders and payments and real estate veterans, with funding led by William Hockey and Zach Perret (Co-founders of Plaid), and joined by folks like Harry Stebbings (Twenty Minute VC), and other angels/operators (Cash App, Plastiq, Mint House).

Opportunity

We are looking for early-career operators who are interested to build in the fintech and real estate spaces. You’d be a great fit if you enjoy building and working in small teams at the early stages when there is room to do more laterally across the company. Your work will have massive impact, as you’ll work alongside our founders and help inform our product and company strategy. We’d prefer a commitment of at least 20 hours/week for 10 weeks to make it worthwhile for both you and Boom.

What you’ll do

  • Build and drive growth for our nascent and rapidly growing partnerships vertical
  • Test and grow new distribution channels across fintech and real estate partners, which may include: defining the channels, designing the outreach process, leading sourcing and onboarding, and defining reporting processes
  • Identify ways to improve our product operations, including payments, rent reporting, and other product delivery-related processes (e.g. our BoomReport and BoomSplit products)
  • Provide feedback to engineering team based on operations and growth experience/customer reception

What you’ll need

  • At least 1-2 years of work experience, preferably at/in an early stage venture, management consulting, or your own business/side hustle
  • Some no-code generalist aptitude - e.g. working with Figma, Webflow, Zapier, FB Ads, etc. to build and test low-fidelity prototypes
  • (preferred) Experience doing marketing, sales or partnerships
  • Ability to operate in situations where information or requirements change constantly
  • A user-focused mindset, with experience running customer discovery interviews a big plus
  • Ability to work self sufficiently and oriented toward action (e.g. deliver against deadlines)
  • (bonus) Fintech, payments and/or real estate experience

Benefits of working at Boom

  • De-risked way to jump into fintech and real estate tech and grow your network
  • Flexible schedule and hours
  • Potential to join full time
  • Entrepreneurial, fun, and supportive culture

As an intern you will help build the incubator program, as we prepare to fuel the next generation of ParentTech startups, in their journey from early stage to venture-backed companies.

Upon launch of the program, you will have the opportunity to witness firsthand the entrepreneural journey, from refinement of ideas, testing with customers, to launch, fundraising and growth.

Maybe you're looking for a role at one of the startups, or interested in entering the world of VC investing, or want to build your own company. Whichever path you choose, this experience will set you up for success.

Duties and Responsibilities

Engage in founder outreach, to select the highest-potential startups to apply to the program.

Coordinate the scheduling and curriculum.

Maintain morale, engagement of mentors, corporate partners, founders, and sponsors.

Plan activities, meetings and events

Qualifications

Interest in technology, startups, entrepreneurship, & venture capital.
Proven attention to detail through prior work or life experience
Experience in event planning and event logistics
Comfortable juggling a variety of responsibilities
Comfortable with a minimal amount of direction but high expectations

About Parenthood Ventures

Parenthood Ventures is an incubator program for FamTech founders: i.e., anyone solving the needs of parents, from fertility to teens; from employee benefits to apps to toys.

Our program is commited to diversity, and solving the needs of families of all forms, including (but not limited to): LGBTQ parents; parents via adoption / surrogacy / fertility treatments; families with support from nannies, grandparents; families managing complex medical needs.

What you’ll do

As a Community + Marketing intern, you will wear many hats and get the opportunity to help with a wide range of projects. This role is perfect for someone who likes the idea of learning about all parts of how the startup industry and the platform community functions and who can juggle and prioritize multiple tasks.

  • Owning the logistics and execution of all social media curation, and collaborating with the Parenthood team on content.
  • Supporting the Parenthood Ventures Slack community through thoughtful engagement and providing resources to frequently asked questions. Collaborating on a community health survey, then synthesizing the data into a report.
  • Engaging in marketing efforts, including planning and drafting of blog posts focused on the FamTech space, compiling a database of potential sponsors/affiliates, and engaging with the Parenthood team on ideation for future marketing plans.
  • Supporting the maintenance of our technology and resource stack.
  • Building out a recommended list of advisors involved in FamTech, as well as collaborating on a framework for a mentor program.

What we’re looking for:

  • Someone who is passionate about building the future of community. You love making connections and engaging folks in conversation, and understand how to synthesize and communicate effectively, but with empathy.
  • An empath who is energized by empowering others. You’ve got a knack for seeing an opportunity to engage our community. You aren’t afraid to get involved in conversations, and you also know when to ask for help when you don’t have the right answers.
  • Someone who is excited about startups and entrepreneurship. You have a solid grasp of the startup ecosystem, and you’re interested in building out an understanding of the FamTech space.
  • An agile teammate who thrives working in a highly independent role, who has the ability to prioritize multiple projects at once. And you’re also comfortable with a variety of tools such as: Google Suite, Canva, Easil, Airtable.

About Parenthood Ventures
Parenthood Ventures is an incubator program for ParentTech founders: i.e., anyone solving the needs of parents, from fertility to teens; from employee benefits to apps to toys. Our growing community exists to elevate the next generation of ParentTech founders and provide resources in their journey from early stage to venture-backed companies.
Our program is committed to diversity, and solving the needs of families of all forms, including (but not limited to): LGBTQ parents; parents via adoption / surrogacy / fertility treatments; families with support from nannies, grandparents; families managing complex medical needs.

Please Note: This is a non-paid internship

Transformative Technology is a 501(c)3 nonprofit whose mission is to bring 1 billion people into a state of fundamental wellbeing by 2030 through the aggregated impact of this global community.

We exist to educate, gather, and activate passionate people committed to building the next generation of transformative technologies that will redefine wellbeing for the next decade. We are the only global platform that connects founders with the resources and tools to succeed in bringing Wellbeing Tech to life, with members in 72 countries and 450 cities.

Transformative Technology is currently looking for people that have a passion for social media, social networking, and community development in the area of wellbeing and wellness!

We are corrently looking for a social media/growth hacking intern to support the following:

  • Social Media: Create/support/analyze social media campaigns to support Transformative Tech
  • Share on Transformative Tech website and social channels (FB, LinkedIn, Twitter, +++).
  • Analyzing data, identify trends among our community and plan digital campaigns to engage community online.
  • Virtual internship. We are a fully remote team.

We are looking for candidates that are interested in Transformative Technology, wellness/wellbeing, health, Machine Learning, AI, Data Visualization, Data Analytics, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, or growth hacking.

Strong candidates will demonstrate:

  • A motivation and ability to self-organize and self-manage projects
  • Deep curiosity and passion for understanding how to improve human wellbeing
  • Interest in the science of wellbeing

What will you get working with Transformative Tech?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging Transformative Technologies.
  • Visionary Organizatoin: Be part of the team that is building the next generation of technologies that will redefine wellbeing for the next decade.
  • Access: TT is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (AI/ML, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what makes you unique! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are getting ready to welcome you. More info @ http://transformativetech.org/. Contact paola@ttacademy.co for more info and/or with any questions!

  • Requires a minimum ~10 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 2-3 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

Thanks.

Paola Téllez,
Transformative Tech Global Community Director

Transformative Tech is currently recruiting team members to join our research team led by Nichol Bradford (https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicholbradford/), co-founder, and publisher of Transformative Technology. This research team seeks to gather people who are passionate about redefining human wellbeing through technology. As a part of this team, interns will each be given their own project to deep dive into how technology (i.e. Artificial Intelligence, AR/VR, BioTech, etc.) is currently being used or could be used towards accelerating human wellbeing (i.e. mental, social, physical, emotional, human performance) in the future.

This position will be most valuable and meaningful for individuals looking to become a founder, investor, or researcher in the field of Wellbeing Tech. This opportunity will allow you to follow your own curiosity and meaningfully contribute to the mission of transforming global wellbeing by shaping our research focus.

Each team member will focus on deep diving into one topic that is among the next frontiers of the mission to accelerate human wellbeing through:

  • Interviewing founders, researchers, and investors in the Wellbeing Technology space
  • Tracking notable founders investors, scientists, and companies in Transformative Tech
  • Analyzing research reports and scientific papers to identify and summarize trends and opportunities
  • Analyzing the gaps in the current focus area and opportunities for the future

Examples of the type of companies you will get to interact with include:
*NeuroTech companies such as Muse (immersive meditation device utilizing neurofeedback), Intheon (world's first neurotechnology middleware platform), and others. *

  • Muse is an immersive meditation device that utilizes EEG ot provide real-time feedback on your mental activity, heart rate, breathing, and body movements to help you build a consistent meditation practice. *BioTech companies such as Oura (personal health tracking device), Epicore Biosystems (proprietary sweat microfluidic sensing platform) *
  • Oura is one of the top personalized health-tracking devices that helps users track their capacity to perform, sleep quality and activity levels. Social Robotics companies such as Moxie (revolutionary robot companion for children)
  • Moxie is a revolutionary robot companion for children that supports social, emotional, and cognitive development through play-based learning. Future of Work companies such as Skillprint, TRIPP, and Perfometric
  • TRIPP is the award-winning leader in XR wellness, offering clinically validated, measurable XR and mobile experiences designed for mind-body health.
  • Performatric is a real-time monitoring system to track and manage mental fatigue in a non-invasive and non-intrusive way. *And more companies utilizing examples of tech listed to improve human wellbeing, such as Artificial Intelligence, AR/VR, Digital Therapy, Healthy Spaces Tech, Wearables, and more.

What will you get working with Transformative Tech?

  • Opportunity: Experience in the transformative technology space.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building technologies that will impact 1B in 10 years.
  • Access: Work with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, gamers, neuroscientists, clinicals, academics, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Community Workshops: Explore topics in the Transformative technology space with thought leades and visionaries.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (game dev, data analytics, product development, biz development, and community building).
  • References/Recommendation

Strong candidates will demonstrate:

  • A motivation and ability to self-organize and self-manage projects .
  • Deep curiosity and passion for understanding how to improve human wellbeing.
  • Interest in the science of wellbeing.

Position logistics:

  • Position is unpaid. We support OPT/CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Compensation available through the federal work­ study program for qualifying students.
  • Requires a minimum ~15 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Full-­time and part-time internships available throughout the fall, spring, and summer periods. Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).
  • Work will be remote with video conference meetings.

The pandemic has not only brought to light but accelerated our global awareness of the need to address our wellbeing today. Additionally, moments of disruption like the one we are in right now highlight how we need a next generation of humans that can go beyond maintaining the status quo by rethinking what it is we need to focus on and how we can do so. This internship aims to help develop our next generation of individuals who can lead and reimagine our fundamental state of global wellbeing.

Please include your resume, and tell us what you like about the Transformative Tech initiave! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://transformativetech.org/. Contact paola@ttacademy.co for more info and/or with any questions!

We look forward to hearing from you.

Ben Simon-Thomas - Transformative Tech - Berkeley Chapter Leader

Paola Téllez Muñoz - Transformative Tech - Project Lead and Recruiting Manager
