Summary

Recharge Thematic Ventures (RTV), a venture capital fund that invests in consumer technologies, has a rare opening on our marketing team. We are seeking a bright, dynamic, and creative MBA candidate with a true passion for startups and venture investing to assist in growing our online brand presence.

We will be accepting applicants until the end of September, aiming for a start date of October 1st.

About Us

RTV is the venture arm of Recharge Capital, a single family office headquartered in Hong Kong with operations in Beijing, New York and Singapore. RTV invests across sectors as varied as fintech, consumer tech, healthtech, and proptech, with a strong emerging markets and consumer angle. The fund also invests across stages, from pre-seed to Series A, and will follow on champion winners. We at RTV act not only as investors, but as partners, bringing our significant talent and operational capabilities to help our portfolio companies grow.

Serving as our Platform and Marketing Intern means stepping into an exciting role at an opportune time. RTV I is in its first investment period, and you would play an integral part in scaling our firm’s marketing and community-building efforts.

Learning Opportunities

You are granted the chance to be at the ground floor of a venture capital firm, and bear witness to our fund scaling upward. You will additionally get to learn the ins and outs of VC by sitting in on our team's regular deal-flow meetings, observing how we connect with founders, and working closely with our analysts on examining global industry trends.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for recommending and driving key content marketing strategies, partnerships, and community development decisions for our firm. Above all, this role will provide you with the opportunity to gain unique exposure to the fast-paced and exhilarating world of venture capital.

Marketing

Your mission is to formulate and execute a clear and effective social media strategy to increase Recharge Capital's reach. You will be responsible for coordinating effective digital marketing campaigns that involve producing interactive content (i.e. founder interviews), writing blog posts, and managing RTV’s social media. You will also help oversee Recharge's media relations with both key opinion leaders and traditional media outlets. You will use your creativity to make and disseminate targeted media that effectively elevates Recharge’s brand name.

Community

You will maintain ongoing communication with founders, partner VCs, and sponsors. Another part of your role is establishing long-standing relationships with founders not yet affiliated with Recharge, collaborating with them to drive engagement both online (AMAs, forums, content and distribution partnerships) and offline (working lunches, networking opportunities, industry-focused dinners, etc.).

We are a small team (two Partners, one Principal, four analysts, and the incoming MBA Intern), working in four-week sprints over a quarterly planning cycle that necessitates extreme focus. You will fully own the creation and execution of our platform strategy, and take our community to new heights.

*Ideally, You: *

• Enjoy distilling salient information down to succinct verbal and written communication

• Possess strong communication skills and an ability to quickly brush up on any subject matter

• Are a creative problem solver and outside-the-box thinker who maintains a great attitude and a willingness to get their hands dirty

• Have been a life-long learner, a voracious reader that naturally explores new ideas and technologies

• Are a natural networker with strong social skills, a self-starter with an ability to own their projects

• Collaborate well across groups, easily build relationships within an organization, demonstrate excellent management skills

• Can work under pressure in a dynamic environment

*Knowledge & Experience *

• Bachelor’s Degree minimum

• 3-5 years of work experience, preferably at a PR/ marketing agency, venture capital, or technology firm

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. We’re eager to invigorate Recharge with different perspectives and worldviews, and diversify our team through this opportunity.

Starting: 1st of October 2021

*Length: * 6 months

Salary: $22,000-$24,500 for 6 months

About us
SafetyDocs Global is an early-stage tech startup in the Regtech space, that focuses in software as service (SaaS) solutions that optimizes document management to lower the incidence of fines and low productivity due to not having the right permits to operate and improve results connecting many departments to access these files and tasks easily. We offer solutions that are cross-industry and specialize in permits management solutions for B2B companies.

  • Manage, track, and report on all activities and results.

The ideal applicant

  • 1+ years of experience in Sales or related field.
  • Strong self-motivation.
  • A desire to dive into analysis and strategies
  • Ability to work alone or as part of a team.
  • Ability to remain calm in fast-paced environments.
  • interpersonal skills.

NOTE: Candidates will also be considered using the eligibility criteria for the DS4Y grant program.

About TextMeAnywhere

TextMeAnywhere is a simple, useful and powerful two-way texting platform which enables businesses to use their existing phone number for texting. Businesses already have their landline numbers that their customers know, and with TextMeAnywhere, these businesses can enhance their communication by connecting with them via text.

150 million text messages are being sent to landline numbers everyday that go nowhere.TextMeAnywhere is a simple solution that eliminates the gap of missed communication and adds a whole new dimension to one of the most important business channels.

TextMeAnywhere is a project conceived by Unite Communications that has been providing exceptional, customized telecommunications services to businesses for over 20 years.

Here is what you’ll do:

You’ll work very closely with the lead developer and help us take TextMeAnywhere application to the next level. The successful candidate will have an appetite to learn and a passion for development.     Frontend

  • Javascript, Node JS;

  • HTML, CSS;

  • Bonus: Knowledge of: Formik, Material UI; Version Control with Git.*

About the Role

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • How to build production software.
  • How large Single Page Applications are built and extended.
  • How backend scales to handle multiple customers and billions of data points while keeping the information secure.
  • How to own a project beginning to end.

We are an inclusive team of software engineers who complement each other's skills to inspire and design solutions that power the Sigma product experience. As an intern on this team, you will have the opportunity to experiment, prototype and implement user visible features that help our customers analyze and gather insights from their data. During the internship period, you will be paired with a mentor and collaborate with other team members, develop designs and implement a chosen solution, deploy and gather insights from customer metrics.

During your internship, you will

  • Partner with other engineers, product managers, and designers
  • Design & deliver innovative solutions to improve the Sigma user experience by implementing new features.
  • Find innovative ways to optimize the performance of one or more components of the product.
  • Develop automated unit tests to get the relevant code coverage and work with product owners and techpubs to document your work.

These will help you to be successful

  • You must be pursuing at least a Bachelor’s or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Have a solid grasp of Operating Systems, Data structures, algorithms and at least one modern programming language such as Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.
  • Eager to learn and build complex user interfaces, data visualizations, or backend systems.
  • Have a drive and desire to navigate unknowns, after all, that’s what unlocks realizations.
  • Ability to collaborate and work in a team environment.
  • Able to commit 40 hrs a week for 12 weeks OR 30 hrs a week for 16 weeks.
  • Ready to start work full-time by late 2022 to early 2023.

Benefits for our Interns:

  • Competitive pay: $40/hour.
  • Flexible schedule, do the work you need to get done in the time you have to get it done
  • Opportunities to interact with Sigma leaders, build your network, and learn about the business.
  • Fun team events throughout your internship!

What’s next:

To get started, submit your application through our job posting. We review the resumes quickly that we receive but sometimes there are a lot of applications so please be sure that the relevant information on your resume stands out.

Every interview process might be a slightly different but generally you can expect the process to look like this:

  • Take-Home Challenge
  • Interview to debrief on the take-home challenge
  • Technical Interview with an engineering team member

We believe that the way people interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. We’re dedicated to empowering this transformation by building the tools and experiences that thousands of developers use to create their own products. Plaid powers the tools millions of people rely on to live a healthier financial life. We work with thousands of companies like Venmo and SoFi, several of the Fortune 500, and many of the largest banks to make it easy for people to connect their financial accounts to the apps and services they want to use. Plaid’s network covers 11,000 financial institutions across the US, Canada, UK and Europe. Founded in 2013, the company is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Salt Lake City, Washington D.C., London and Amsterdam.

We’re architected around decoupled services. You could be working on our internal distributed systems framework that holds them all together, or building out the newest version of our API. Most of our back-end core systems are written in Go, but that's not a prerequisite. We pick the right tool for the job and have systems in Go, TypeScript, and Python.

What excites us

  • Degree in engineering, CS, physics, math, statistics, or another related field
  • Strong track record of building interesting projects, whether during internships, for school, or independently
  • Great fundamentals and a strong command of at least one language
  • Product mindset. You understand that building the right tools and systems can impact millions of users
  • Adaptability. Most of our engineers work across the entire stack, touching everything from the front end to our core infrastructure

What is Pathrise?
Pathrise (YC W18) is an online program for tech professionals that provides 1-on-1 mentorship, training and advice to help anyone land their next job. On top of that, we're built around aligned incentives. Fellows only pay when they get hired and start working at a job first.

Every day we are expanding our team and our services. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our fellows chances of getting the jobs of their dreams! If this sounds like something you'd be interested we’d like the opportunity to get to know you more.

Our Mission
We seek to uplift job seekers in their careers and help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. Read more about why we’re driven to do this in our manifesto.

The Role
We’re looking for natural teachers who care about mentorship and uplifting others. As a Data Science Intern, your main responsibility would be to perform admission sessions for our Data track, helping fellows with technical interview prep and from time to time working on internal data projects.

Responsibilities

  • Handling 1-on-1 admissions sessions, technical interview prep and occasional behavioral prep
  • Investing in students’ personal stories and advising them on their career trajectory in the admissions calls and giving proactive feedback
  • Building up and improving on the admissions process for data fellows
  • Conduct data analysis for Pathrise and contribute to the overall effectiveness of the data track

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience working on data-related projects whether that be in academic projects, internships or other related work experience
  • A passion for mentorship!
  • Be available for 10+ hours a week
  • 1+ years of experience in data science, technology industry or in a related field
  • Experience with teaching, career advising, and mentorship in education or tech

Pathrise Values...

  • Growing employees: we value giving and receiving feedback (constructively) and we value continuous improvement. We want you to grow professionally and we include a professional development stipend to help you achieve that.
  • Diversity, equity and inclusion: we value people, opinions and thoughts from diverse backgrounds. Our culture is built upon the pillar of ‘DEI is not a separate initiative from Pathrise it is a part of Pathrise.’ We invite all to share their stories and we believe that it is through acceptance and curiosity that we can create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

We cannot sponsor visas for this role at the time. Thank you for your interest.

Immuta is the universal cloud data access control platform, enabling data teams to automate data access control on any cloud, using any data platform, at scale. With Immuta, organizations can finally unlock the full value of their data – even the most sensitive data – while improving productivity, reducing time to data, maintaining strong security, and enabling new data sharing use cases.

Since our founding in 2015, Immuta has now become the leader in cloud data access control. That comes by applying our expertise in engineering, security, ethics, and law. But, more importantly, it requires a relentless focus on our customers’ needs. Immuta’s customers understand that data is the most critical asset for innovation. Secure, democratized, self-service access to cloud-based data is an imperative to accelerate business intelligence, data science, and data sharing outcomes.

  • Immuta has been recognized by Forbes as a top American startup employer, by Inc. Magazine as one of the best workplaces, and by Fast Company as one of the top 50 most innovative companies
  • Customers include Aon, Credit Suisse, Daimler, S&P Global, U.S. Army, and Atlassian. Over half of the top banks now use Immuta
  • Partners include Databricks, Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Starburst
  • $169 million in total venture capital funding. Investors include Greenspring Associates, March Capital, Ten Eleven Ventures, Intel Capital Corporation, NGP Capital, DFJ Growth, Dell Technologies Capital, Citi Ventures, Inc, Wipro Ventures, and Okta Ventures
  • Major offices in Boston, Massachusetts; Columbus, Ohio; and, College Park, Maryland

Immuta Scholars Program

Immuta is committed to fostering relationships with universities and research institutes, in both the legal academy and in computer science, mathematics and other departments central to the legal and ethical use of data. To promote such relationships, and to ensure Immuta’s own experts contribute to and learn from ongoing research efforts, we host the Immuta Scholars program, a research effort designed to facilitate cutting edge research at the intersection of technology and the law.

Immuta Scholars come from faculties, think tanks, postdoctoral research programs and graduate student bodies. Our only requirement is a passion for law and technology, and a commitment to our values—the legal and ethical use of data. We have hosted Immuta Scholars for single or multiple terms, typically aligned to the academic semester. Past Scholars have come from institutions such as Yale Law School and the University of Chicago.

Examples of Active Research

Past Immuta Scholars have focused their research on, among other topics:

  • Formal methods for representing privacy policies in logical, machine-executable form (including semantic- and object-oriented approaches).
  • A literature review of legal requirements and associated best practices related to transparency in data processing.
  • Research on emerging legal requirements relating to data privacy and security for edge- and cloud-based computing.

  • 100% employer paid mental wellness platform for you and your dependents
  • Stock Options
  • Wellness perks (100% employer paid Whoop fitness band and subscription)
  • Paid parental leave (Both Maternity and Paternity)
  • Unlimited Paid time off
